This borrower belongs to the Mujeres Unidas Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Inés is 63 years old, married, and has six children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells all types of products, including basic needs items like rice, sugar, and milk. She has been in this business for years and it is how she gets her family ahead. She is happy because this business brings her a great deal of satisfaction and she also has the help of her children.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of more products for her business such as sweets, pastas, basic needs items, etc. so that she can have more variety to offer to her customers.

Inés is happy because of the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her business such as sweets, pastas, basic needs items, etc. so that she can have more variety to offer to her customers

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marisol; ella tiene 32 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia tiene una combi que presta servicio público todos los días desde las 06:00am hasta las 10:00pm, siendo su esposo quien maneja el carro y a veces la socia le ayuda cobrando los pasajes al público en general, por otro lado la socia se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y de su casa, la socia espera poder comprar otro carro y a si agrandar su pequeña empresa. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y para comprar algunos accesorios que le hace falta. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Mujeres Unidas Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Marisol is 32 years old, has a live-in partner and a son. She has a ‘combi’ (a large van used in public transportation in Peru) that she uses to offer public service every day from 6am to 10pm. Her partner is the one who drives the vehicle and she helps him by collecting the bus fares from the general public. On the other hand, Marisol also looks after her child and her house. She hopes to be able to buy another vehicle to expand her small business.

She is requesting the loan for vehicle maintenance and to buy some accessories that she doesn’t have.

Marisol is happy because of the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance and to buy some accessories that she doesn’t have

loans.name: Maria Eustaquia

texts.es:
la señora Maria Eustaquia García tiene 58 años de edad, esta casada y no tiene hijos que dependen de ella,   vive con su esposo el señor Bartolome Gutierrez quien se dedica a la agricultura y cria de vacas.
 
la señora Maria elabora pan y tamales desde hace varios años,  sus ventas son ambulantes con los vecinos y amigos de la comunidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de huevos, harina, manteca, queso, agua, levadura, soda, leña.
con las ganancias desea ahorrar para hacerle una reparacion a la casa.
 
es una persona muy humilde y conocida por vecinos de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Eustaquia G. is 58 years old, married, and doesn’t have any children dependent upon her. She lives with her husband, Bartolome Gutierrez, who works in agriculture and in raising cows.

Maria has made bread and tamales for several years and she makes her sales by foot to her neighbors and friends in the community. She will use the loan for the purchase of eggs, flour, butter, cheese, water, yeast, baking soda, and firewood. With the earnings, she wants to save to make a repair to the house.

She is a very humble person and is well-known by the neighbors in the community.

loans.use: Purchase of eggs, flour, butter, cheese, water, yeast, baking soda, and firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
el joven Juan Carlos T. tiene 21 años de edad y vive en union libre, no tiene hijos que dependen de el.
Juan tiene un pequeño negocio en casa de la abuela, en el cual junto con su mujer venden frescos, golosinas, churros, manteca, jabon, etc. tiene una pequeña pulperia, ademas sale realizar trabajos de medio tiempo para
ayudarse un poco con la economia de su casa.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio ya que se aproxima la epoca de clases y desea tener surtido para venderle a los niños que van a la escuela.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos T. is 21 years old, has a live-in partner and does not have dependent children. He has a small business in his grandmother's house where, together with his wife, he sells soft drinks, candies, churros, lard, soap, etc. He has a small grocery store. He also does part-time jobs to help with the household economy. 

He will use this loan to purchase merchandise to stock his business since the start of classes is approaching and he wants to have an assortment of merchandise to sell to the schoolchildren.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, churros, water, sugar, candy, juice, lard, oil, beans, rice, bread and cookies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
Oscar de 35 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, él vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad, en su hogar solo él trabaja para proveer la alimentación mensual.
El Taller de Oscar inicio hace mucho y trabaja de lunes a sábado de 8:00am a 4:00pm en su casa muchas veces y otras a domicilio. Por el momento está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales esta inversión le permitirá dar cumplimiento a los trabajos pendientes y a los que día con día le llegan.
Su objetivo es ofrecer un buen servicio, trabajos de calidad, ampliar el taller y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Oscar is 35 years old and lives in El Transito in the department San Miguel with his wife and two children, ages 8 and 6.  In his household he is responsible for the monthly food bill.  Oscar owns a metal shop that he started many years ago.  He works Monday through Saturday from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm, much of the time from home.  He is requesting a loan to purchase materials which will allow him to complete his backlog of work and also those jobs he gets on a day to day basis.  His goal is to offer good service and quality work, to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his metal shop

loans.name: Santos Arcadio

texts.es:
el señor Santos Arcadio A. tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos que dependen de el, su esposa le ayuda con la pulperia cuando el sale a hacer las compras, viven en la aldea Agua Zarca de San Lorenzo.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y surtir su pulperia, nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio le esta generando ganancias. 
su deseo en este año es que su negocio sea mas grande y que su familia este siempre bien de salud.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de estudios y alimentacion de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos Arcadio A. is 48 years old.  He is married and has four kids who depend on him.  His wife helps him with his general store when he has to leave to purchase things.  The family lives in Agua Zarca de San Lorenzo.


He will use the loan to buy merchandise and grow his general store.  He told us he is very happy that is business is generating revenue.  His dreams for this year are that his business grows much bigger and that his family stays healthy.  His family needs the revenue from the store to cover school costs and food for his children.

loans.use: Buying tomatoes, potatoes, bananas, onions, carrots, soups, creams, beans, rice, sugar, soap, eggs, drinks, pastas, butter, oil, churros, matches, and batteries to stock his store

loans.name: Federico José

texts.es:
Don Federico José G. R. trabaja como higienista en el mercado Oriental de Managua, desde hace 7 años.

Es casado de 31 años de edad, con tres personas a su cargo, este es el crédito número seis que presta en CEPRODEL todos los créditos incluyendo este los solicita para reparación de vivienda. Agradece a CEPRODEL por la oportunidad que le da de mejorar su casa poco a poco ya que es una persona de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Federico has worked as a hygienist in the Oriental (Eastern) Market in the capital, Managua. He has been married since he was 31 years old and is responsible for the wellbeing of three persons.  

This is Federico's 6th loan with CEPRODEL. All of these loans, including this one, he solicited for repairing his home.  Federico is grateful to CEPRODEL for the opportunity which it offers to improve his house, little by little, since he is a person with scarce financial resources.

loans.use: REPAIRING HIS HOME

loans.name: Idail

texts.es:
la señora Idail H. L. tiene 51 años de edad,  es madre soltera de tres hijos.
Su negocio a sido siempre la venta de comida, a luchado para sacar adelante a su familia, tiene su propia casa en la residencial Panchita, nos comento que con esfuerzo y dedicacion a construido su casa.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de alimentos para producir sus desayunos, almuerzos y golosinas, sus productos se venden mucho ya que su negocio se encuentra en una zona muy transitada de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.

las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Idail H. L. is 51 years old and a single mother to three children. She has always worked in food sales in order to provide for her family.  With effort and dedication she built her own house in the Panchita neighborhood.  

She will use the loan to purchase food to prepare breakfasts, lunches and sweets.   Her sales are good since her business is located in a very busy area in the city of San Lorenzo.  Her earnings cover her household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, juices, coffee, pork, beef, chicken, tortillas, butter, oil, beans, eggs, vegetables, bread, rice, sugar and cheese.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: Leonel tiene 56 años, su actividad es la elaboración de cuarterones. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio este negocio en su casa de habitación con el paso del tiempo es que el fue adquiriendo experiencia con este medio de vida. El siempre está buscando la forma de cómo ganarse la vida ya que todos los días tiene que trabajar bajo el sol para poder hacer sus cuartos. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando y obtener más clientes. el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de herramientas, materiales, cementos, ladrillos entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Leonel is 56 years old and he makes bricks.  Some 12 years ago he didn't have this business.  He began the business in his residence.  With the passage of time, he gained experience in this way of life. 

Leonel is always looking for ways to earn his living, since every day he must work under the sun to be able to make his bricks.  In the future,  he wants to continue his work and to obtain more customers.  The financing he solicits is for buying  tools, material, cement, and floor tiles, among other things.

loans.use: BUYING TOOLS, MATERIAL, CEMENT, AND FLOOR TILES FOR HIS BRICK-MAKING BUSINESS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
El señor Juan de Dios D. B. trabaja como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental desde hace 14 meses.
Es casado de 42 años de edad, con 4 personas a su cargo tres hijos en edad escolar, su esposa es ama de casa.
Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL, lo solicita para reparar su vivienda y poder brindarles a sus hijos una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Señor Juan de Dios D. B. has worked as a hygienist in the Mercado Oriental (Eastern Market) for the last 14 months.
He is married, 42 years old and provides for 4 family members, his three school-aged children and his wife, who is a homemaker.
This is his first loan with CEPRODEL.  He is requesting the loan in order to make repairs to his housing and give his children a better home.

loans.use: Household repairs

loans.name: León Ángel

texts.es:
A sus 60 años de edad, León Ángel A., no conoce otro oficio que el de carnicero, pues desde pequeño al lado de sus tíos aprendió de este trabajo. Desde hace 6 años y después de trabajar para otros en diferentes carnecerías, descubrió que para salir adelante era necesario montar su propio negocio, pues de esta forma mejoraría sus ingresos, su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

Actualmente, León necesita de un crédito para comprar surtido y así incrementar sus ventas, lo que se convertirá en mayores ingresos, pues actualmente es el responsable de mantener un hogar en el que son 6 los integrantes. 

Desde que León creó su propio negocio se ha encontrado como limitante la falta de capital, pues para salir adelante, viéndose obligado a surtir diariamente, lo que demanda mayor cansancio físico y disminución de utilidades al no poder comprar en mayores cantidades para obtener mejores precios.
texts.en:
At 60 years of age, León Ángel A. knows no other trade than that of butcher.  He learned his trade from his uncles when he was young.  Six years ago, and after working for others in various butcher shops, he discovered that he would need to start up his own business to get ahead.  With his own business, he would be able to improve his earnings, his quality of life, and that of his family.

Currently, León needs a loan to purchase stock for his shop, which will increase his sales and his profits.  He is responsible for providing for a household of six.

Since León started his own business, he has found lack of capital to be a limitation.  For him to get ahead, he needs to re-stock his shop each day. This causes him greater physical fatigue and creates a decrease in profits.  If he cannot purchase large quantities, he does not get good prices.

loans.use: To purchase supplies (meat)

loans.name: Nuevo Atardecer (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nuevo Atardecer. En esta ocasión nos acompaña en la foto del grupo la hermana de una de las socias, la socia viste una blusa morada y detrás esta su hermana.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y así poder obtener su primer crédito con la finalidad de mejorar sus negocios y su vida. Ellos se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como, (comercio, ventas, producción y  servicios,). Para nuestra amiga y el grupo en si este es su primer ciclo en  el banco y están muy a gusto porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer.

Aquí conocimos a la señora María, tiene 25 años de edad y está casada y de esta relación tiene una hija de 2 años y seis meses. Su marido trabaja en una empresa de transporte.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que  se dedica al comercio,  vende  sandalias por catalogo y ropa de todo tipo,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también entrega bajo  pedidos ya que tiene varios clientes que le realizan los pedidos con anticipación y también vende sus productos en su casa. Ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra semanalmente lo cual es una ventaja ya que a la vez que realiza sus cobros también utiliza ese momento para realizar nuevas ventas. Las sandalias las recibe en una distribuidora en Portoviejo, la ropa la compra  en Guayaquil. Trabaja sola y lleva  en este negocio ya  tres años, nos cuenta que le ha ido muy bien y lo que más vende son las sandalias y ropa de mujer.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mercadería para incrementar su negocio como pantalones, camisas, blusas, sandalias  entre otras. Sus sueños son llegar a tener su propia casa ya que vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
Every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds because of the large quantity of the fruit that used to grow there, there is a meeting of the members of the communal bank Nuevo Atardecer (New Dusk).  On this occasion, we are visited by the sister of one of the members.  In the photo, the member is dressed in a purple blouse, and her sister is behind her.

This is a group of people who decided to come together in order to obtain their first loan with the purpose of improving their businesses and their lives.  They make their livings in various activities, such as commerce, sales, production and services.  This is the first cycle with the communal bank for our friend and for the group itself.  They are very satisfied because the loans are easy to get. 

Here we meet Señora María.  She is 25 years old, is married and has a 2 1/2-year old daughter.  Her husband works for a shipping company.

Señora María is a good housewife and makes her living in commerce.  She sells all types of clothing from a catalog and sandals.  She makes her sales going door to door and also from customers who pre-order their purchases.  In addition, she sells products from her home.   Señora María sells her merchandise on credit and collects payments on a weekly basis.  This provides her an advantage, as she she makes use of the collections time to make new sales.  She gets the sandals from a distributor in Portoviejo, and she purchases the clothing in Guayaquil. She works alone, has been running this business for three years, and she tells us that it has been going very well for her.  What she sells the most of is sandals and women's clothing.

She is going to use this loan to purchase merchandise, like pants, shirts, blouses, sandals and other items, in order to grow her business.  Her dream is to one day have her own home, since she currently lives in her in-laws' house.

loans.use: To purchase sandals, pants, shirts, blouses etc.

loans.name: Maria Mavel

texts.es:
Doña María resiD. en Puerto el Triunfo departamento D. Usulután, tiene dos hijos D. 16 y 20 años D. edad, quienes dependen económicamente D. ella, su negocio es la venta D. zapatos y ropa americana este negocio lo administra desD. hace 2 años , su edad es 43 años D. edad. 
Ella Esta pendiente D. una caja D. mercadería que le llegara, pero aun no tiene el valor D. ella, por eso solicita un préstamo para estar lista en el momento que le llegue su pedido, con esta ayuda podrá cancelar la mercadería en el instante que llegue su proveedor, así mismo está fortaleciendo su inventario para ofrecer mayor cantidad D. mercadería a los clientes.
Sueña con alcanzar desarrollo en su negocio, verlo granD. y con mayor demanda, poder atender los compromisos que requiera para mantenerlo en marcha y además quiere ver a su familia unida que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Doña María lives in Puerto el Triunfo, Usulután Department.  She is 43 years old. She has two children who are 16 and 20 years old and who are financially dependent on her.  Her business is selling shoes and American clothing.  She has run this business for 2 years.
She is waiting for a box of merchandise to arrive, but she still doesn't have the money for it.  She is requesting the loan to be ready whenever the order arrives.  With this financial help, she will be able to pay off the merchandise as soon as the supplier delivers it.  She is increasing her inventory to be able to offer a greater quantity of merchandise to her customers.
She dreams of building up her business, to see it grow big and have a greater demand for her products.  She wants to be able to take care of the commitments that are required to keep her business running.  And additionally, she wants to see her family united and for her children become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (clothing and shoes).

loans.name: Martin Antonio

texts.es:
Don Martín Antonio Bustos trabaja como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua desde hace 10 años.
Es casado con 4 personas a su cargo, su esposa y tres hijos menores de 15 años, es decir en edad escolar. Su esposa trabaja como ama de casa. Solo cuentan con los ingresos del prestatario
Este es el crédito número 12 con CEPRODEL los que ha pagado en tiempo y forma ya que es una persona responsable. Este crédito lo necesita para mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martín Antonio Bustos has been working as a custodian in Managua's Western Market for the past 10 years.

He is married and supports four people; his wife and three young school-aged children.  His wife works as a housekeeper.  They are only able to count on the borrower's income.

This will be his 12th loan through CEPRODEL and he has repaid the previous ones responsibly and on time.  He needs this loan in order to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Don Ricardo, es un señor de familia, vive con sus hijos, su esposa, él tiene 54 años de edad, es docente del centro escolar, residen en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután.
A don Ricardo se le presenta la oportunidad de comprar un terreno pero no cuenta con los fondos suficientes por eso está solicitando un préstamo para completar su costo y realizar esta inversión aprovechando  la venta que se le presenta, con esta adquisición esta aumentado sus bienes inmuebles.
Su aspiración es algún día poseer abundantes inmuebles para heredar a sus hijos o también poder comercializarlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a man of the house and lives with his wife and children in Jiquilisco, in the Usulután department.  He is 54 years old and works as a school teacher.

Ricardo has the opportunity to buy some land, but he does not have enough capital, so he is requesting a loan in order to make up the difference and be able to make this investment.  He wants to take advantage of this sale.  This acquisition will increase his real estate.

He hopes to one day own lots of land so that he can leave it to his children or resell it at a profit.

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Virginia Vanessa

texts.es: Virginia tiene 30 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y compra de ropa, busca como proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues para su negocio son muy importantes. Por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su hogar y poder mejorar su condición. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar faldas, pantalones, vestidos, pantalones y trajes formales. Sueña con aumentar su inventario para ofrecerles a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Virginia is 30 years old.  She buys and sells clothing and works to provide her family with their daily bread.  This is not her first loan, as [loans] are important to her business.  She is constantly looking for new ways to generate income and improve her family's quality of life.

She is asking for this loan so she can invest in skirts, pants, dresses, and formal slacks and suits.  She hopes to be able to increase her inventory so that she can offer her customers a greater variety of products.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Lilian Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Lilian, tiene 48 años de edad, tiene un molino y tienda, vive con su hermana es casa de esta, quien le ha autorizado para que instale el negocio, ellas viven en San Miguel departamento de San Miguel, trabaja en el molino de 9:00am a 2:00pm, el resto del día prepara la venta y sale a una cancha de futbol que está cerca, ahi es donde se dispone a vender a las personas que están recreándose.
Ella por el momento se le ha dañado el molino y necesita comprar repuestos, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de dichos repuestos y aprovechara para comprar mercadería para la tienda, con esta inversión tendrá un mejor servicio para los clientes ya que su variedad de productos espera atender las diferentes necesidades de la clientela.
Su objetivo es estar al pendiente de los problemas del molino, ya que su constante mantenimiento le permite funcionar perfectamente y tener estable el servicio a los clientes, también estabiliza sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lilian is 48 years old and has a mill and a store. She lives with her sister at her sister's home. Her sister has allowed her to set up her business there. They both live in the San Miguel department of San Miguel. Lilian works at the mill from 9:00 am until 2:00 pm. The rest of the day she prepares her sales and goes out to a nearby football field where she sells to people that are recreating.

Currently, her mill is broken and she needs to buy spare parts which is why she is requesting this loan to purchase spare parts and at the same time to purchase merchandise for her store. With this investment she will be able to provide her clients with better services by providing a variety of products for her client's different needs. 

Her goal is to be aware of the mill's problems since its constant maintenance allows it to function perfectly and allows Lilian to provide her clients with a stable service. This also stabilizes Lilian's income.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for a mill and purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Orlando José

texts.es:
Don Orlando José L. trabaja como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua desde hace 17 años.
Es Acompañado con 4 personas a su cargo, su compañera de vida y un hijo. Su compañera trabaja como ama de casa. Solo cuenta con los ingresos de él.
Este es el crédito número 8 con CEPRODEL los que ha pagado en tiempo y forma ya que es una persona responsable. Este crédito lo necesita para compra de materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Orlando José L. has been working as a hygienist at the oriental market in Managua for 17 years.

He is accompanied by his four dependents, his life partner and his son. His partner works as a housekeeper and only counts with his income. 

This is the 8th loan he has received from field partner CEPRODEL. He has paid his previous loans on time because he is a responsible person. He needs this loan to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene 37 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y que disfruta de su actividad como es la elaboración y venta de pan. Sus inicios se dan hace mas de 20 años y fue por su Madre, quien todavía le ayuda en el negocio para la elaboración de sus deliciosos panes. Ella es muy reconocida en su cuadra por ofrecer muy buenos servicios y excelente calidad. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de queso, mantequilla, huevo, harina entre otras cosas. Desea establecerse en un lugar que sea propio.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 37 years old and is a hard-working woman who enjoys making and selling bread.  She started this work over 20 years ago because of her mother who helps her with the business baking delicious bread.

She is well-known on her block because of her good service and excellent quality.  She needs the loan to buy cheese, butter, eggs, and flour, among other things.  One day she hopes to be able to buy her own place for the business.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Mery Beatriz

texts.es: Mery tienes 26 años y vive en Chaclacayo, ella es madre soltera, pues tiene una hija de 1 año y está estudiando en la Escuela Lennys la carrera de “Cosmiatria” (masajista), este programa durara 1 año y espera con esto poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Indica que su sueño es tener su propio centro de estética donde ejerza sus estudios, además indica que esta carrera es la que la apasiona pues le gusta mejorar la apariencia y ver a sus clientes relajados para seguir con sus vidas. Ella sabe que sus metas le costaran mucho esfuerzo y que las habilitaciones de Edaprospo le ayudaran mucho a conseguirlas.
texts.en:
Mery is 26 years old and lives in Chaclacayo.  She is the single mother of a 1-year-old daughter, and is studying Cosmetology (massage therapy) at the Lennys School.  This is a 1-year program, and she hopes that with this degree she will be able to improve her standard of living.

She notes that her dream is to have her own esthetics center where she could practice her studies.  In addition, she indicates that this career is her passion.  She likes to improve peoples’ appearance and wants to see her clients relaxed so they can move forward with their lives.  She knows that her goals will entail a great deal of hard work, and that the help from Edaprospo will help her attain them.

loans.use: To purchase products and supplies.

loans.name: Nueva Amistad Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “NUEVA AMISTAD” es un grupo de 8  mujeres que han decidido unirse para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud,  serán parte del centro focal de Panamericana, ellas están iniciando su primer ciclo.

Cada una de las socias tiene negocio propio, de servicio, producción o comercio. Entre ellos tenemos:    carnicería, venta de condimentos, sastrería, venta de pescado, tienda de barrio, tejidos a máquina, venta de dulces en un anaquel, venta de papas fritas.

Para su organización, la B. C. Nueva Amistad cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Elena, una tesorera, la señora  Jovita y una secretaria de actas, la señora  Rita.
 
La Tesorera, la señora  Jovita está casada, tiene 5 hijos varones y 1 hija mujer.    El negocio de la señora  Jovita se encuentra en  la Feria de Lagunas, consiste en la venta de chuño remojado (papa deshidratada que nuevamente es hidratada para ser utilizada), trigo cocido, mote cocido, ají molido.  Este negocio fue creado por iniciativa propia hace tres años cuando la señora Jovita se dio cuenta que hacía falta este tipo de productos en la Feria (listos para ser utilizados en la cocina), los días de venta recibe la ayuda de su hijita.     El préstamo solicitado fue por Bs.800.- y será destinado para la compra de chuño,trigo, maíz y ají seco.

La señora tesorera nunca había sido socia de Pro Mujer, esta es su primera experiencia,  cuando se le consulta que es lo que le atrae de la institución, ella responde “el ahorro”.
texts.en:
The cooperative bank “NUEVA AMISTAD” (“New Friendship”) is a group of 8 women who decided to join together for a loan and training.  They will be part of the focal center of Panamericana, and are starting their first cycle.

Each one of the members has their own business involving a service, production or commerce.  Among them we have:  butcher, condiment sales, tailor, seafood sales, neighborhood general store, knitwear, candy and French fries sales.  

The organization has a management board comprised of a president, Ms. Elena, a treasurer, Ms. Jovita, and a secretary, Ms. Rita.

The Treasurer, Ms. Jovita, is married and has 5 sons and a daughter.  Her business is located at the Lagunas Market, and consists of selling chuño remojado (dehydrated potatoes, re-hydrated for use), boiled wheat, stewed maize, and ground peppers.  She started this business on her own three years ago, after taking notice that these types of items were missing at the market (ready for use in the kitchen).  On the days she sells, she gets help from her daughter.

The loan portion she requested is 800 Bolivianos, and will be used to buy dehydrated potatoes, wheat, corn and dry peppers.  This is her first time working with Pro Mujer and, when asked what attracts her most to the institution, she replies “the savings”.

loans.use: To purchase dehydrated potatoes, corn, peppers and wheat.

loans.name: Heradio Adrian

texts.es: El señor Heradio posee un negocio que es una pulpería. Y está ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace nueve años. El realiza sus compras de contado y sus ventas son al crédito y de contado, las compras las efectúa en el mercado donde le resulta mucho más favorable ya que así compra el por mayor. Pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y mantener a su familia. El está solicitando un financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, además es padre de cuatro niños y solamente dos están a su cargo, los cuales asisten al colegio y están a su cargo. El nos cuenta que sueña con mejorar su actividad económica que es su medio de vida.
texts.en:
Heradio has a general store business that has been located in his home for nine years.  He buys his supplies in cash, and sells his products both in cash and on credit.  He purchases his products at the market, which is much more cost-effective since he can buy at wholesale prices.  He has always enjoyed working and supporting his family.  

He is requesting a loan to invest in his business.  He is the father of four children, but only two are still in school and dependent on him.  He tells us that his dream is to improve his enterprise, as it is his way of life.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Daysi Romelia

texts.es:
Doña Daysi, tiene 42 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vive con sus ocho hijos y la casa donde habita es de una de sus hijas, doña Daysi se dedica a costurar y venta de hamacas, sus trabajos de sastrería los realiza en su casa y consiguió trabajar en la elaboración de uniformes por parte del gobierno para la escuela, también con la ayuda de sus hijas elaboran hamacas para vender.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser, y otra parte para materiales para fabricar hamacas, esta ayuda le dará una mejor disposición de materiales para hacer las hamacas y la adquisición de la maquina agilizara su trabajo entregándolo en menor tiempo y con la posibilidad de que reciba ayuda de otra persona para que no solo ella se dedique a este oficio.
Sueña con tener una vivienda, que sus hijas puedan encontrar trabajo y mejorar en unión  con sus hijos la condición económica de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Daysi is 42 years old. She lives in San Francisco Gotera, departament of Morazán. She lives with her eight children and the house where she lives belongs to one of her daughters. Daysi sews and sells hammocks. She does her sewing in the house and she was able to get work from the government making school uniforms. With her daughters' help, she also makes hammocks to sell.  

She needs a loan to buy a sewing machine as well as to buy materials to make hammocks. This help will give her greater materials availability to make the hammocks, and the acquisition of the machine will facilitate her work. She will finish in less time and have the possibility of getting help from another person so she is not the only one doing this work. 

She dreams of having a store, and for her daughters to be able to find work and with her children to improve the financial condition of the whole family.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and materials to make hammocks.

loans.name: René

texts.es:
El señor René M. K., trabaja como colector de impuesto, cobrándoles a los comerciantes del Mercado Oriental de Managua desde hace 3 años.
Es casado con 3 personas a su cargo que dependen de él lleva 4 crédito en CEPRODEL los que ha pagado en tiempo y forma, este crédito lo solicita para los gastos de medicina de una hija que tiene 26 años de edad y padece de Leucemia y otra hija que tiene Diabetes, ambas tienen que tomar medicamentos costosos y alimentos especiales permanentemente, y por otro lado tiene incurrir en gastos de colegiatura para el período 2011.
texts.en:
Mr. René M. K. has worked as a tax collector at the Eastern Market of Mangua for three years.

He is married with three dependents, and he has had four loans from CEPRODEL which he has paid on time and in full. He will use this loans to cover medical expenses for two of his daughters. One daughter, 26, has Lukemia and another suffers from diabetes. They both require expensive medicine to treat their illnesses as well as special diets. Additionally, Mr. M. K. must pay high school enrollment fees for the 2011 school year for his dependents.

loans.use: Medical expenses and school fees

loans.name: Rosmery Yanira

texts.es:
Rosmery D. 32 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. antojitos, Vive en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán junto a su esposo y su hija, ella tiene el negocio D. venta D. platillos como nuégados con miel, plátano tostado, papas fritas, yuca frita, estos antojitos son preparados a diario y ofrecerlos a los clientes.
Ella tiene la necesidad D. un préstamo para comprar materiales y preparativos para realizar las ventas diarias, sus materiales necesarios son plátanos, yuca, aceite, papas, D. estos depenD. los ingresos D. Rosmery.
Ella espera algún día tener una mejor condición económica que le permita realizar estas ventas sin necesidad D. recurrir a préstamo y ver mayores ingresos para ayudar a sus hijos en lo necesario.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 32 years old and sells snacks.  She lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department, together with her husband and daughter.  Her business is selling dishes such as 'nuégados con miel' (a traditional Salvadoran dessert), toasted plantain, French fries and fried cassava.  She prepares these snacks daily and offers them to her customers.

Rosmery needs a loan to buy materials and supplies for making her daily sales.  The materials she needs are plantains, cassava, oil and potatoes.  These are what Rosmery's income depends on.

Some day, Rosmery hopes to be in a better financial position that will allow her to make her sales without having to have recourse to a loan.  She also hopes to make more income in order to help her children with everything they need.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for making her sales

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Tereza De Jesús tiene 28 años, su actividad es la venta de cerdos esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos ya que han sido, muy importantes para su negocio. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una persona muy luchadora y disfruta de su medio de vida. Ella se levanta temprano pues tiene que buscar las mejores ofertas que le realizan, ella sido una mujer muy responsable con sus cuotas de pago ya que sabe que por medio de los financiamientos es que ha podido sacar adelante su negocio. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de cerdos, que son necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en: Tereza de Jesus is 28 years old. Her business is selling pigs and it is not the first time she accesses a loan. Loans have been important for her business. She has always been a fighter and she enjoys her way of life. She wakes very early in the morning to take advantage of the best deals. She has been very responsible with her loan payments and she knows that these loans are the best way to progress with her business. She wants this loan to purchase pigs, which are necessary for her business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Aura Nohemy

texts.es:
Doña Aura S. O., es trabajadora de la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua (UNAN), desempeñando el cargo de Aseadora en la unidad de intendencia, desde hace 4 años.
Es soltera de 31 años de edad, con 2 personas a su cargo. Este es el quinto crédito que trabaja en CEPRODEL, y lo necesita para mejora de vivienda.
Agradece a CEPRODEL por haberle otorgado estos créditos ya que le ayudan a mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aura S. O. has been an employee of the "Nacional Autonoma (UNAM)" university in Nicaragua for the past 4 years, working as a janitor in the maintenance unit. 

She is single and she has 2 individuals in her care. This is her fifth loan she has accessed through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner), and she needs it to carry out some home improvements.

She is grateful to Ceprodel for having granted her these loans; they have improved her quality of life.

loans.use: To make home improvements.

loans.name: Maria Calixtra

texts.es: María Calixta tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en Fundación, pues ha sido una gran experiencia para ella y su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, leña, tiste y frijoles cocidos ya que su negocio es muy humilde pero le proporciona el alimento diario a ella y su familia. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a su negocio a comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece y que son necesarios en el hogar. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de gaseosas, frijoles, tiste entre otros productos que ofrece.
texts.en: Maria Calixta has been a long-time client of Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner). It has been a great experience and a benefit for her business. She sells soft drinks, firewood, tiste (a cocoa bean drink) and cooked beans. Her business is very humble but it provides daily food for herself and for her family. The majority of her clients come to her business to purchase a variety of products for the home. She requires this loan to purchase soft drinks, beans, tiste, and other products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Lamrana

texts.en: This is 40 year-old Lamrana J..  She is married, and has four children aged six, eight, twelve and fifteen years. In 1990, Lamrana established her food stuff business. She began her business because she wanted to be self reliance and as a means of getting income to support her family.  Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about 400,000SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000SLL. Lamrana has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to expand her business and increase her profit margin for the support of her home. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000SLL. In the future, Lamrana plans to help her husband build a house and educate her children to university level.  Buy a vehicle as a means of getting another income to up keep the family, open a shop for whole sale.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buy more food stuff for her stall

loans.name: Sobeyda Yasmina

texts.es: Sobeyda tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 14 años que tiene este negocio, pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona responsable y disfruta de su medio de vida ya que el tratar con clientes es lo que más le gusta. Sabe que todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para ofrecer la gran variedad de productos que ofrece. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de lápiz labial, cremas, perfumes, ropa en general, calzado entre otros.
texts.en: Sobeyda is 45 years old, and she sells general merchandise for a living.  She has had this business for more than 14 years, and this is not the first time she has used loans or credit to help her develop the business.  She has always defined herself as a responsible person, and she enjoys her way of life, as interacting with customers is what she likes most.  She knows that every days she has to get up early to be able to offer a wide variety of products.  She plans to use the funds from this loan to buy lip pencils, creams, perfumes, clothing, and shoes, among other things.

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Olga Leticia R.  esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual su negocio ha tenido mas ingreso. 
Esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para poder invertir en mas equipos y acondicionar el local y así poder contratar a una persona para que le ayude a las ventas de aparatos y accesorios de teléfonos celulares. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio ya que los gastos familiares se encargan.
texts.en: Mrs. Olga Leticia Ramirez is very thankful for the support provided by her last loan, which helped her increase her business' income.  She is applying for a new loan to invest in more equipment and set up her premises.  In this way, she will be able to hire someone to help her with the sale of cellular phones and phone accessories. She plans to pay the back the loan with the profits she makes in her business, as her household expenses are already taken care of.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment for business

loans.name: Segunda

texts.es: Segunda tiene 42 años, su actividad es la venta de cerdos pues siempre está pensando en mejorar sus ingresos ya que es una persona muy inteligente y que goza de tener un medio de vida necesario para mantener a su menor de edad que está a su cargo ella es una persona muy luchadora, se siente muy feliz por tener este medio de vida que es muy importante. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de comida de cerdos y para comprar cerdos.
texts.en: Segunda is 42 years old, and she makes a living by selling pigs.  Always thinking of ways to raise her income, she is an intelligent person who enjoys her way of life and the opportunities it offers to financially support a minor who is in her charge. She is a hardworking person, and she feels happy to have this business as an important part of her life.  She will use this loan to buy pig feed, and also to buy pigs.

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Jariatu W..  She is married, and has three children aged 8, 12, and 16 years old. She has no other dependents.  In 2000, Jariatu W. established her cooking utensils (plastic & pan) business. She began her business as a way of getting a livelihood for her family.  Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about 750,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan for 3,000,000 SLL.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Jariatu W. plans to educate her children to university level, open a bigger store for her business and supply other traders. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: working capital--tools for home electronics repairs

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 55-year-old Kadiatu K.. She is married and has five children aged 13, 15, 19, 22 and 25 years. She has three additional dependents who live with her because she wants to educate them and have them help in her business. In 1980, Kadiatu established her cooking utensils (assorted items) business. She began her business because she wanted to promote herself and her family. Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about 500,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to increase her business stock and make more profits to help support her home. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Kadiatu K. plans to help her husband build a house and educate her children to university level, travel to a neighboring country for more goods and open a wholesale shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils for her business

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
El señor Raúl H. ya ha tenido un crédito con Kiva el cual pago puntual mente y pudo realizare la mejora. 
Esta solicitando otro préstamo ya que el cuarto que construyo le esta haciendo falta las ventanas y puertas para que este ya casi terminado. Ya que es la recamara de sus hijos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una maquiladora en el departamento de producción.
Desea que sus hijos tenga ya su propio es pació en la casa, es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación para este crédito.
texts.en:
Mr Raúl H. has already had a loan with Kiva, which he paid very punctually and used successfully to make the improvement.
He is requesting another loan since the room that he built needs windows and doors; it is almost finished. It is his children's room.
He plans to repay the loan with part of the income that he earns from his work in a factory in the production department.
He wants his children to have their own space in the house, so he is requesting your cooperation in this loan.

loans.use: to put up the doors and windows

loans.name: La Ceiba Group

texts.es: La señora MARIA NIEVES es integrante del grupo La Ceiba, su negocio es la venta D. abarrotes, ella menciona que su negocio es heredado ya que anteriormente lo atendían sus suegros ya fallecidos. La señora Maria lleva 25 años prestando el servicio, tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales dos estudian; uno D. ellos está estudiando para ingeniero y una menor D. edad cursa la primaria, su esposo trabaja en una agencia D. refrescos como chofer. María menciona que su tienda era y sigue siendo D. las más reconocidas en el pueblo por su antiguedad ya que fue una D. las primeras en la comunidad. Su sueño es con el credito invertir para satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes mismos que mantienen su fidelidad hacia su negocio. Observación: La señora Florida S. A. es la que no se ve bien, la segunda D. izquierda a derecha.
texts.en:
María Nieves is a member of the “La Ceiba” (the Kapok tree) Communal Bank.  Her business is selling groceries.  She says that she inherited the business that her now deceased parents-in-law had.  María has worked in the business for 25 years.  She has three children, and two of them go to school.  One of them is studying engineering, and a younger one is in elementary school.  Her husband is a driver for a soft drink company.

María comments that her store was, and continues to be, the most well-known in the town because it has been there for so long.  It was one of the first in the community.

Her dream is to use the loan to meet the needs of her customers who are loyal to her business.

Note:  Forida S. A. is the one that cannot be seen well.  She is the second one, going from left to right.

loans.use: To make her business grow

loans.name: Las Colibris Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de la de la Sra. Piedad R., una integrante del grupo  Las Colibrís, que esta ubicado en el Estado de Morelos en  México, en la fotografía se ve el horno rustico que utiliza para hacer el pan, es un horno  hecho de ladrillo y barro, utiliza leña para hornear el pan. Ella se dedica a la venta de pan,  negocio que inicio hace 20 años junto con su esposo, en sus inicios  rentaban el local donde hacían el pan, ahora ya tienen un local propio,  Solicita el préstamo para comprar una batidora y unas charolas para colocar el  pan. Sus clientes se sienten contentos porque siempre los atiende con amabilidad y el sabor especial que tiene su pan casero. Al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque tendrá su batidora con lo que podrá aumentar la producción. Tiene 40 años de edad estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria es casada tiene 2 hijas una casada de 20 años y la menor de 13 años. Con las ganancias de su negocio desea seguir dándole estudios a su hija para que llegue a tener una carrera.El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Piedad R.' business.  Piedad is a member of the 'Las Colibrís' (Hummingbirds) group which is located in the State of Morelos in Mexico.  In the photograph you can see the rustic oven that she uses to make her bread.  The oven is made from brick and mud and runs on firewood.  Piedad's business is selling bread.  She has been in this business, together with her husband, for 20 years.  Originally, they used to rent the premises in which they made their bread but now they own their own premises.

Piedad is requesting this loan to buy a mixer and some trays on which she can place her bread.  Her customers are happy because she always serves them with kindness and they enjoy the special flavor of her home-made bread.  At the moment of requesting this loan, Piedad feels happy because she knows that she will get her mixer which will help her to increase her production.

Piedad is 40 years old and studied up to the third year of high school.  She is married and has two daughters.  Her eldest daughter is 20 years old and married, and her younger daughter is 13.  Piedad would like to use the profits from her business to continue providing her daughter with an education so that she can eventually become a professional.  This group has 10 members.

loans.use: To buy electrical appliances for making bread

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo D. is from the village of Baybay Liloy Zamboanga Del norte. He is 49 years old. Alfredo is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Alfredo owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alfredo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alfredo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Topurchase raw ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Yunie

texts.en:
Yunie is from the village of Patawag Liloy Zamboanga del Norte. She is 53 years old. Yunie is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Yunie is starting a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business will come from providing dress making services to local community. Yunie is just starting this business.

In 2010, Yunie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yunie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment and tools such as needles and threads. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Yunie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve general living conditions for her family.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase tools/supplies such as needles & threads

Justina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Justina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Marbin

texts.en:
Marbin is from the village of Fatima Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte. He is 45 years old. Marbin is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marbin owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing photography services to the local community. Marbin has been engaged in his business for over  years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Marbin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marbin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Marbin is requesting a new loan of 45000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marbin from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Jazmines Sumi Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la señora Norma, una integrante del grupo Jazmines sumi, que está ubicado en el Estado de VeraC., en México. Se ve al grupo de señoras al rededor de la ropa que vende la señora Norma en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa que inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mas ropa de tempoarada y tener bien surtido su negocio. Sus compañeras y clientes la conocen por ser una persona responsable, trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta ya que aún es buena fecha para vender se ropa de invierno. Tiene 38 años, estudio hasta secundaria, es casada y tiene en total 3 hijos, 2 varones y 1 mujer. Quiere este crédito para surtir su negocio de ropa y con ello mejorar sus ventas. También espera seguir apoyando a su hija con la carrera de Ingenieria de Biotecnologica en Puebla y en un futuro poder construir en su casa unos cuatros para sus hijos.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in the home of Mrs Norma, a member of the Jazmines Sumi group, which is located in the VeraC. state, Mexico. The women are pictured around the clothing that Norma sells. She has sold clothing for three years. She is requesting this loan to purchase more seasonal clothing in order to have her store well-stocked. Her friends and customers know her as a responsible, hard-working person who is dedicated to her family.
She is very happy that it is already a good time to sell her winter clothing. She is 38, and studied up to high school. She is married with 3 children; 2 sons and one daughter. She wants this loan to stock her clothing business and improve her sales. She also hopes to continue supporting her daughter with her biotechnology engineering studies in Puebla. In the future, she hopes to build some rooms in her home for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more seasonal clothing for the business

loans.name: Melda

texts.en:
Melda is from the village of Imelda Labason Zamboanga Del norte. She is 49 years old. Melda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Melda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling beef products in the local community. Melda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Melda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Melda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Melda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Dorlita

texts.en:
Dorlita is from the village of Bobongan Labason Zamboanga Del norte. She is 57 years old. Dorlita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Dorlita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Dorlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Dorlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorlita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Dorlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena B. is from the village of Galas, Dipolog City. She is 40 years old, married, and has two school-aged children and one infant child. To make a living, Lorena sells fruits and vegetables in the local community.  She has been engaged in this business for over 2 years.

In 2009, Lorena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Lorena is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vegetables and root crops to sell. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and root crops to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is from the village of Poblacion, Concepcion. She is 51 years old, married, and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Annie owns and operates a grocery store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of her income comes from selling of made-to-order cakes and other delicacies. Annie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2010, Annie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annie is requesting her 2nd loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Ribyola

texts.en:
Ribyola is from the village of Minaog. She is 37 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. Ribyola operates a family member's business in the food sector, making and selling processed meat in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ribyola joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ribyola is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ribyola from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for business

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo X Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama SAN JUDAS TADEO X, debido a la gran fe que le tienen a este Santo, por resolver las causas imposibles. El grupo pertenece a la comunidad de Bosques de Manzanilla, en el Estado de Puebla,  formado por 10  personas.La Tesorera del grupo es Doña Altagracia Reyna, tiene 47 años, es casada, estudio únicamente la primaria, se dedica a la venta de calzado y tiene actualmente 2 depedientes económicos. La Presidenta del grupo es Doña Rosa Hernández Q., quien se dedica a la  venta de ropa, telas y artículos de temporada,  estudio únicamente hasta la primaria, casada y cuenta con tres dependientes económicos, ella  es una mujer que ha salido adelante ante la pobreza y adversidad ante la falta de preparación educativa, nuestro crédito lo ocupa para realizar pedidos por adelantado y obtener mayor ganancia,  sus compañeras la conocen desde hace tiempo, les consta que es  una persona trabajadora y honesta.
texts.en:
This group is called San Judas Tadeo X, because of the great faith that they have in this saint for solving impossible problems. The group belongs to the Bosques de Manzanilla community, in the Puebla state. It is made up of 10 people. The group treasurer is Mrs. Altagracia Reyna. She is 47, married, and has only an elementary education. She sells shoes and has two economic dependents. 
The group president is Mrs. Rosa H. Q., who sells clothing, fabric and seasonal items. She has only an elementary education. She is married and has three economic dependents. She is a woman who has gotten ahead of poverty and adversity despite her lack of education. She will use this loan to fill some orders in advance and make a better income. The members of this group have known her for a long time, and say that she is a hard-working and honest person.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIGGEYE est créé le 15 décembre 2008 lors de l'inauguration de son Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 30 femmes qui sont originaires de quartiers différents mais qui chaque mois se réunisse au tour des activités du Banc Villageois. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de HLM NDIAMBOUR. 

Ndèye Ami C. debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elles est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de 2 garçons et une fille. 

fait du petit commerce. Elle vend des parfums, des écharpes. Elle vends aussi des vêtements pour enfants. Elle pratique cette activité depuis environs 06 ans.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle pourra renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices. 

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de prendre en charge ses enfants
texts.en:
The Takku Liggeye solidarity group was created on December 15, 2008 at the creation of Banc Villageois. It is composed of 30 women from different districts who meet each month within the framework of Banc VIllageois activities. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of HLM Ndiambour.

Ndèye Amy C., standing on the far right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 35 years old. She is divorced and has two sons and one daughter. [She] has a small business retailing items such as perfumes and scarves. She also sells children’s clothing. She has been in this business for six years. With her new loan she will be able to expand her stock so as to increase her income. Her goal is to be able to support herself and provide for her children.

loans.use: Purchasing perfumes, scarves and children's clothing

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is from the village of Miputak. He is 40 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. Allan operates a family member's business in the food sector, running a food stall in the local community. He has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Allan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Allan is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials for his food vending business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Allan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions for his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for food vending business

loans.name: Gloria

Gloria is from the village of Biasong. She is 50 years old, widowed, and has 4 school-aged children. Gloria operates a family member's business in the retail sector, selling firewood in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions for her family.

loans.name: Pablo Jr.'s Group

texts.en:
Pablo A. is from the village of Oyan, Sibutad. He is 39 years old. Pablo is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Pablo is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Pablo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector growing assorted crops to sell. Pablo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Pablo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pablo is requesting his 1st loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
