loans.name: Cumawas Group

texts.en:
Jonalyn C. lives in the village of Miputak. She is 31 years old and leads a two-person loan group that receives funding from PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan for their fellow group member if one is delinquent or defaults.

Jonalyn is married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living by raising pigs in her backyard. She has been in this business for more than 3 years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Jonalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid seven previous loans from PMPC, and used each of them to buy piglets and feeds. 

Jonalyn and her loan group are applying for a new loan of 14,900 PHP to buy additional piglets, feeds and construction materials for her business.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, feeds and construction materials

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
To make a living, Anecita J. runs a grocery store selling household items in the local community.  From this activity, Anecita earns a monthly net income of 3500.00. She has been running her business for 6 years. Anecita is 38 years old, married, and blessed with school-aged children. She resides in Napilan, Sapang Dalaga.
 
In 2006, Anecita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 27,000 PHP from PMPC.  This previous loan was used for personal purposes.  Anecita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used as working capital. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Anecita from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as working capital

loans.name: Virginia's Group

texts.en:
Virginia E. is from the village of El Paraiso, Sapang Dalaga. She is 49 years old. Virginia is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Virginia is married and has no children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business selling "tuba" native wine in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 1200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Virginia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & to fund working capital. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory & use as working capital

location.town: El Paraiso, Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ.

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo I Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama San Judas Tadeo I, está ubicado en San Martín Texmelucan en el Estado de puebla. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. Felix S. H es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 42 años, estudió hasta el 3ro de secundaria. Es casada y tiene en total 3 varones.  Ella se dedica a vender en una cooperativa escolar que inició hace 2 años. Aparte tiene su negocio de comida que con ayuda de su esposo atienden por la tarde comenta que gracias a este tipo de prestamos a logrado sobresalir con el paso de los años, al igual apenas inicio un pequeño negocio de papelería. Solicita el préstamo para compra de refrescos, jugos y otras cosas para su negocio. Sus clientes son alumnos y maestros de la escuela. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada ya que obtiene un crédito que para ella es importante para sobresalir cada día. Quiere este crédito para compra de refrescos, jugos y pan, gas y una mesa para que puedan comer los maestros. También espera que con este préstamo y su esfuerzo poder tener unas mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called San Judas Tadeo 1. It is located in San Martín Texmelucan, in Puebla state. The group has 9 members. Felix S. H. is the group president. She is 42 and studied up to the third grade of secondary school. She is married and has 3 sons. She sells in a school cooperative that she started two years ago. She also has a food sales business with which she helps her husband in the afternoons. She says that thanks to these loans she has been able to excel as the years have passed. She recently started a grocery store business. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of drinks, juice and other items for her business. 
Her customers are students and teachers at the school. She is excited to be getting the loan that for her is so important to her success. She wants this loan for purchasing drinks, juice and bread, pop and a table where the teachers will eat.
She also hopes that through this loan and her hard work she and her family will have  better quality of life.

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan C. is from the barangay of P-2 Carangan, Ozamiz City. He is 40 years old. Alan is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Alan owns and operates a motor cab.  He is also engaged in hog raising activities. He has been running these businesses for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Alan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used as working capital for his hog raising business. This will be the 2nd loan taken by Alan from PMPC.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital for hog raising business

loans.name: Palo Grande Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Palo Grande porque así se llama la colonia donde se reúne el grupo y se ubica en la comunidad de Tlaquiltenango en Morelos en México. El grupo esta formado por 10 integrantes. Petra González es la presidenta del grupo y tiene 54 años. No tiene estudios, es comerciante. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, negocio que inicio hace 16 años. Solicita el préstamo para surtir de mercancía su negocio como son, productos  de la canasta básica arroz, frijol, aceite, sal, azúcar, etc. Tiene 2 hijos una mujer y un varón, Sus clientes la prefieren por ser una persona amable y atenta. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta porque sabe que con las ganancias obtenidas logrará parte de sus objetivos como son, darle una pintada  a la fachada de su tienda. También espera comprar una pequeña estufa para su casa porque cocina con leña.
texts.en:
This group is called Palo Grande, because this is the name of the development where they meet. They are located in the Tlaquiltenango community in Morelos, Mexico. The group is made up of 10 members. Petra Gonzales is the group president and is 54. She has no education and is a merchant. She sells groceries, a business that she started 16 years ago. She is requesting this loan to stock her business with merchandise such as basic household items: rice, beans, salt, sugar, etc.
She has 2 children; one daughter and one son. Her customers prefer her because she is a likable and attentive person. She is happy because she knows that the income she makes from this loan will form part of her goals, which include painting her storefront. She also hopes to buy a small stove for her house because she cooks with firewood.

loans.use: she will purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Tesoros De Amacuzac Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Tesoros de Amacuzac se ubica en la comunidad de Amacuzac en el Estado de Morelos en México. Esta comunidad se distingue por su famoso Rio cuyo nombre es Amacuzac en este se practican Deportes extremos como Rápidos en Kayak y Competencias en lanchas. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes  y es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito.Olga Damiana O. Vázquez es Tesorera del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos negocio que inicio hace 20 años, la Sra. inicio su negocio por que su necesidades económicas  crecían por la llegada de sus hijos, ya que el ingreso de su esposo ya no era suficiente para solventar los gastos de la familia,  solicita el préstamo para comprar mercancía, va a comprar cosméticos, tiene 39 años, estudio una carrera técnica para secretaria Ejecutiva,  es casada y tiene un total de 3 hijos de 18,15 y 13 años respectivamente, sus clientes la prefieren porque siempre encuentran los artículos que necesitan,  al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente muy contenta porque va a poder pagar sus pedidos, quiere este crédito para agrandar su negocio, con las ganancias espera pagar los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group, called Tesoros de Amacuzac, is located in the Amacuzac community in Morelos state, Mexico. This community is known for its famous river, the Amacuzac, where extreme sports are practiced, such as kayaking the rapids and speedboat competitions. The group is made up of 10 members, and this is the second time that they have requested a loan. 
Olga Damiana O. Vazques is the group treasurer. She sells cosmetics, a business that she started 20 years ago. She started her business when her economic needs grew after her children arrived, since her husband's income was not enough to cover the family's costs. She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise. She will purchase cosmetics. She is 39 and studied to be an executive secretary. She is married with 3 children ages 18, 15 and 13. Her customers prefer her because she always finds the items that they need. She is very happy to have requested this loan because she will pay her orders. She wants this loan for expanding her business. With her earnings, she hopes to pay her children's school costs.

loans.use: she will purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Davaatseren

texts.en:
Davaatseren A. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. They all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His oldest two sons are attending a local primary school. His wife currently stays at home to take care of their younger daughter.  Previously, between 2006 and 2008, she operated a consumer goods trading business.

Davaatseren supports his entire family by operating three separate businesses:  a vegetable growing and trading business, a taxi service, and a mobile dairy retail business. He grows a variety of vegetables to sell to local traders after harvesting them. He started this business in 2003 and has made quick progress. 

After years of successful operations, Davaatseren managed to buy a car.  This enabled him to start his other two businesses in 2009:  a taxi service and a mobile dairy products trading business.  He has gained significant experience and skills in his businesses over the years. He a is skilled businessman and an open-minded person. 

Davaatseren is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products to resell

loans.name: Las Gaselas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Las Gaselas, esta ubicado en el estado de Morelos en  México, esta comunidad se distingue por tener una hacienda que fue fundada por Hernán C., este fue un inmueble importante productor de azúcar y granos, El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un crédito.Elva A. L. es integrante del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de estambres negocio que inicio hace 3 años, solicita su préstamo para comprar mas productos, Tiene 34 años, estudio la preparatoria es casada, tiene una hija, sus clientes están a gusto porque siempre  encuentran los productos que necesitan, al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque con el crédito podrá comprar más producto para hacer crecer su negocio y obtendrá mayores ganancias con las que podrá seguir pagando los estudios de su hija.l
texts.en:
This group, Las Gaselas (The Gazelles), are located in the State of Morelos and it is distinguished for having an hacienda founded by Hernan C. (the conquistador). The property has been important as a producer of sugar and grains. The group is composed of 10 members and this is the first time they have solicited a loan.

Elva is a member of the group. She sells woolen yarn, a business she started some 3 years ago. Elva requests a loan to buy more products. She is 34 years old, studied in preparatory school, is married, and has a daughter. Her customers are happy because they always find the products they need.

Upon soliciting the loan, Elva feels content because with this loan she will be able to buy more products to make her business grow, and she will obtain greater earnings, enabling her to continue paying for her daughter's studies.

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE (WOOLEN YARN) FOR THEIR BUSINESS

loans.name: Las Peras Del Bicentenario Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama LAS PERAS DEL BICENTENARIO, ellas se consideran unas personas que luchan por lo que quieren, pero sobre todo que defienden sus ideas ante cualquier persona. Este grupo esta ubicado en la Ciudad de Tula de Allende Hidalgo. La Sra Cecilia R. C. es integrante del grupo antes mencioando arriba, la Sra. Cecilia R. C. tiene 54 años, estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria y se dedica a la venta de cuadros desde hace ocho años. Ella quiere este credito para la compra de mas cuadros, ya que ella considera que esta es muy buena epoca para la venta de sus cuadros, ella espera que con este credito y con sus ventas tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This group is called LAS PERAS DEL BICENTENARIO.  The members are fighters and they fight for what they want and, above all, to protect their aspirations.  The members of the group live in the Mexican city of Tula de Allende Hidalgo.  Sra. Cecilia R. C. is one member.  She is 54 years old and has a sixth-grade education.  She has operated a business selling pictures for eight years.  She will use this loan to buy more pictures because she thinks that this is a good time to sell them.  She hopes that the loan and her own efforts to sell her pictures will give her a better quality of life.

loans.use: Buy art for resale.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hovd province in Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest daughter is a university student and her younger two sons are attending a local school. Her husband works for the thermal power station during the winter months and operates a construction business during the summer months to supplement his family income. 

Myagmarsuren operates a meat trading business in her town. She started her business in 2006 and has become very experienced in her trade.  Her working capital has decreased due to the rise in the price of meat. Therefore, she plans to use this loan to purchase a large amount of meat at cheap prices and resell them during the spring months when prices for such products are higher. 

Myagmarsuren is a hardworking and modest person and says, "I plan to build my own house for my family in my fence by next year". She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase three cows at a cheap price for her meat trading business.

loans.use: To purchase three cows

loans.name: Gaviotas De Atla Group

texts.es: Este grupo se ubica en una comunidad cercana al municipio de tenango del valle muy conocida por la fabricacion de globo y asi mismo la de pan,este grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes de los cuales la señora sofia Montañez C. se dedica a la fabricacion de pan el cual tiene este oficio desde pequeña ya que toda la familia siempre han ejercido dicha actividad su familia esta conformada por cinco hijos de los cuales son tres mujeres y dos hombres todos ellos ya conforman su propia familia .De la señora sofia ya nadie depende, ella vende su producto en santiago tianquistenco.La señora enviudo hace dos años , su anhelo de ella es que sus hijos enseñen a sus nietos la fabricacion de pan y esta actividad continue de generacion en generacion.
texts.en:
This group (Seagulls of Atla) is located in a community near the municipality of Tenango del Valle, very well known for making balloons and also bread. The group is composed of 10 members, among whom Sofia is dedicated to making bread.

Sofia has been doing this since she was small, as her entire family has always done this. Her family is composed of 5 children, of whom 3 are women and 2 are men. All of them have established their own families. Sofia no longer has dependents. 

Sofia sells her products in Santiago Tianquistenco. She has been a widow since 2 years ago. Her hope is that her children will teach her grandchildren how to make bread and that this activity continues from generation to generation.

loans.use: TO BUY PRIMARY MATERIALS FOR THEIR BAKERY

loans.name: Progresando Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “progresando para el futuro”, por que van progresando para un futuro mejor para su familia gracias a los prestamos que han sacado. Esta ubicado en el Estado de Mexico. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes .La señora Ma. De Lourdes Gonzales D. L., es integrante del grupo.Tiene 37 años, estudio solo la primaria, es floricultora y tiene en total 3 hijos(1 mujer y 2 hombres). Ella se dedica al cultivo de gerbera que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar planta y fertilizante para su cultivo siguiente.Sus clientes comentan que la señora lourdes tiene una variedad diferente a las demas personas que se dedican a cultivar gerbera, por eso las prefieren las de la señora Lourdes, ella inicio como trabajadora y conforme fue adquiriendo conocimientos decidio iniciar su cultivo , y gracias a los prestamos lo a logrado. Al solicitar este prestamo ella se siente muy contenta y con mucho animo pra seguir progresando. Quiere este prestamo para empezar su cultivo, que se va a cosechar para el mes de febrero en el dia del amor y la amistad. Ella espera que algun dia tenga la oportunidad de viajar a otros paises para dar a conocer sus flores. Y asi poder seguir progresando para darles mejores estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Progresando para el Futuro” (Making Progress for the Future).   They selected this name because, thanks to the loans they have had, they are making progress for a better future for their families .  The group is located in the state of Mexico.  It is comprised of nine members.

María De Lourdes Gonzales D. L. is a member of the group.  She is 37 years old, and she only has an elementary school education.  She grows flowers, and she has three children (one girl and two boys).  She started growing gerbera (a flower from the sunflower family) two years ago.

She is requesting a loan to buy plants and fertilizers for her next crop.  Her customers say that Lourdes has a different variety than the other people who grow gerbera.  That is why they prefer the flowers that Lourdes grows.  She started as a hard worker, and she accordingly was gaining knowledge.  She decided to start her crop.  Thanks to the loans, she was successful.  

As she is requesting this loan she feels very happy, and she is very encouraged to keep making progress.  She wants this loan to start the crop that she will harvest for Valentine’s Day in February.  She hopes that one day she will have the opportunity to travel to other countries to learn about their flowers.  That way she will continue to make progress in order to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en:
Tumenbayar is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house which was built after obtaining a loan from Xacbank. His wife operates a clothes making and repair service in a rented space to supplement the family's income. 

Tumenbayar operates an iron crafting business in his town.  From his shop inside a shipping container at the local market, he produces a variety of chimney and household iron products. He started his business in 2005 after working as a welder since 2002. He graduated from a construction institute as a welder in 1992. 

After years of operation, Tumenbayar has grown his business into a stable operation and has gained significant experience as a skilled ironsmith. Tumenbayar is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary materials and supplies for both his and his wife's businesses.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: Ulziisaihan

texts.en:
Ulziisaihan is 40 years old and lives in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. He lives alone in his own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent inside his sister's fence. Ulziisaihan operates a mobile dairy retail trading business in his town. He started his business in 2008 with the help of his sister. He purchases his dairy products from local herders at wholesale price and sells those products to his permanent suppliers in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Ulziisaihan plans to expand his business in the future by signing with his business partners. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy supplies in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy supplies

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP MAME DIARRA est créé le 15 décembre 2008 lors de l'inauguration de son Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 17 femmes qui sont originaires de quartiers différents mais qui chaque mois se réunissent au tour des activités du Banc Villageois. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de HLM NDIAMBOUR. 

Fatou N. debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants et de 02 filles (une de sa sœur et une de sa parente) 

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus, de parfums, de l'encens, de pâte alimentaire etc. Elle a une bonne expérience pour avoir pratiquer cette activité depuis 2001

Son prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité et de réaliser plus de revenus financiers

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille surtout pour la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: The solidarity group SOP MAME DIARRA was founded on December 15, 2008 during the inauguration of its village bank (Banc Villageois).  It counts 17 women who come from different districts, but get together every month to take care Banc Villageois business.  The group is a part of the Banc Villageois of HLM NDIAMBOUR.  Fatou N., first on the right of the photograph, is in charge of the group.  She is 43 years old, married and is the mother of nine of her own children and two other girls (one from her sister and one from another relative).  She has a small business selling fabric, perfumes, incense and pasta, etc.  She has a lot of experience as she has been in business since 2001.  This loan will allow her to further grow her business and increase revenues.  Her goal is to help her husband take care of the family and most certainly to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fabric, perfumes, incense and pastas.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is from the village of Villa M Tejero Liloy Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old. Elsie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business making & selling pork products in the local community. Elsie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is from the village of Villa M. Tejero Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 22 years old. Mary Ann is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Mary Ann sells soft drinks in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mary Ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Mary Ann from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

location.town: Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Ulziibayar

texts.en:
Ulziibayar B. is 43 years old and lives with his mother, wife and three children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, inside his sibling's fence. His oldest two children are university students and his youngest daughter is attending a local high school. 

With the help of his wife, Ulziibayar operates a business producing construction blocks and road plates. He manufactures his products during the summer months in enough quantity to sell all season.  He began this construction material producing business in 2009 after operating another business since 2002. Before starting his businesses, he worked as a mechanic for a road and construction  company since 1988. 

With his business earnings, Ulziibayar was able to pay his children's tuition fees. He is a modest and hardworking person.  He is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase more cement, pigments and strengtheners used to produce a variety of concrete blocks and road plates.

loans.use: To purchase more cement, pigments and strengtheners

loans.name: Julieto

texts.en:
Julieto is from the village of Bonifacio Extension, Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old. Julieto is single. To make a living, Julieto owns and operates a business making homemade cookies. Julieto has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In December 2010, Julieto joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieto is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients to make cookies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for his family.

 About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for cookies business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen G. is from the village of Maningcol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 74 years old and is married to Rico G.. They are blessed with 3 children, one is school-aged and the two are adults. 

In July 2010, Carmen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of Paglaum MPC under Pension Loan Program, Carmen has successfully repaid a loan of 30,000 PHP. She is now requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to pay tuition fees for her daughter.

About PMPC:

Tsevelmaa operates a dairy trading business out of a rented stall at the local market where she sells a variety of dairy products to her customers. She started this business in 2008 after living a nomadic lifestyle. She purchases her dairy products from local herders at wholesale price and sells those products as a retailer. 

After years of running her business, she has built a stable operation and has managed to increase her product line. In the future, Tsevelmaa wants to expand her business so that she can afford to build her own house inside her fence for her family. She is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy supplies in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Nargiza Tolobekova's Group

texts.en:
In recent years cell phone usage by Kyrgyz citizens has grown rapidly. The booming cell phone service industry employs thousands of employees and is a top taxpayer with huge contributions into the country’s budget. 

Nargiza T., 32, is a leader of this group. She previously worked as a clerk for a cell phone providing company. Getting acquainted with this industry, she opened a shop selling phone accessories and communication appliances. Step by step she managed to broaden her assortment of products and build a regular customer base. She spends the generated revenue paying for rent, taxes and purchasing fresh models of accessories for reselling. Nargiza earns a profit of 4,000 soms monthly, most of which is used to provide for her son's and daughter's daily needs. Now she is asking for a loan in order to invest in purchasing mobile phone accessories to resell. If everything goes well, Nargiza hopes to undertake major repairs on her house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone accessories to resell

loans.name: Asma Muhammad Altaf's Group

texts.en:
Asma lives in a historic city called Multan which is known for its shrines and hot weather. She lives there with her family in the area of Yaqoob town in a two-room brick house. Her husband is a welder by profession and welds spare parts and iron items. His shop is located in the market from where he has been operating his business for the past 10 years. 

Asma helps her husband financially by doing embroidery. Embroidery is a very common business in Multan and most of the ladies do it from their homes. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and finishes the orders on time to earn an income. She has a son and a daughter. Both are very young and not yet of school-going age. 

Asma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s welding business. With the loan, he will purchase another welding machine and hire an assistant which will help him do his business better and offer quality services to his clients. 

Asma hopes that her husband will earn a better income with the help of his improved business conditions after the investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has established good credit behavior in her previous loan year and never missed a meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Asma”.

loans.use: To buy another welding machine for a welding business

loans.name: Dilbarkhon Bokoeva's Group

texts.en:
The following story is about a woman, who feels a big responsibility for all who are dear to her. She hopes to make every single member of the group happy by offering each one a part of the loan. 

Dilbarkhon B., 49, is a leader of this group. For the past two years, she and her husband have been involved in a cattle reselling business. Most of the work is done by Dilbarkhon, because her husband’s main occupation is construction. Purchasing cattle is not a simple process. Customers usually pay careful attention to the physical appearance of the animal, its health and price. Sometimes Dilbarkhon has to wait several days in order to sell the cattle at a good price. Thanks to her good bargaining skills, she is usually successful. Unfortunately, she doesn’t get help from her children in taking care of the cattle, because all three of them are pursuing a degree in the bigger city of Osh. She is happy with how life has turned out and wishes her children the best. After thorough consideration of the financial possibilities, Dilbarkhon applied for a loan, which she would like to spend on buying more cattle. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Reoung

texts.en: Reoung S., 24, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband sells salt, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food and USD 40 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more salt to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more salt to resell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is from the village of Madalag. She is 42 years old and is a group member of PMPC. She is married and has eight children. To make a living,  Violeta operates a business which is a plantation of seaweed (also known in the community as "agar-agar"). The harvest is carried out after the plantation has been in the sea for three months: it is then dried in the drier after which it is ready to be sold. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Violeta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 2,500 PHP which will be used to provide additional capital for buying materials for her business. This will be the fifth loan that Violeta has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for buying materials for her business

location.town: Madalag, Jose Dalan Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Aitilla Attokurova's Group

texts.en:
Aitilla A., 47, is the treasurer of this group. She has gathered a group of hard-working and persistent entrepreneurs with exceptional skills and knowledge in their sphere. The joint application of their skills will play a big role in promoting the business and successfully repaying the loan. 

Aitilla is the mother of two boys and the wife of a farmer. Like many other women, she is engaged in trade. For the past three years, she’s been working in a local open air bazaar selling consumer goods and groceries. Aitilla is very popular among her customers, who come from her neighborhood and the general community. She believes this loan will have a positive effect on her business. She works in this line of business thanks to her sister’s advice. Returns from business have allowed her to make the gift of a brand new car to her husband. Aitilla plans to invest the money in buying products to better implement her grocery store and expects to continue progressing. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience goods to resell

loans.name: Nai

texts.en: Nai R., 50, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. R. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more construction supplies to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan fR. CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. R. appears in the photograph with her mother.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies to improve her husband's business

loans.name: Azizbek's Group

texts.en:
Kerben is a small town in western Kyrgyzstan, known for its hospitable people, gastronomy, culture and beauty of its nature. Also it’s a small trading center connecting many high-populated regions.

Azizbek A., 24, is a member of this group. A young resident of Kerben, after graduating from college, lost hope of finding a job in his area of specialization. He followed the example of a friend who started up their own business. Azizbek is single and doesn’t have any financial dependents. Two years ago he embarked on a household goods and office supplies sales business. He used 30,000 soms for a business start-up and since then his business generates a significant income allowing him to cover all his expenses and have some savings. Azizbek has heard of another very successful market, Jibek-Jolu, where he would like to rent a place to work. He believes that moving to a new market will increase his income. The purpose of the loan is to purchase a container to strengthen the business. Azizbek values the loan and pledges to make his payments on time. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a container

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem N., 43, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. She sells vegetables, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 40 on other necessary expenses. N. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use.

loans.name: Gulumkan's Group

texts.en:
Independent entrepreneurship is the most preferred manner of doing business. It brings chances for self-development, taking risks and managing your personal finance.

Gulumkan C., 26, is a leader of this group. She resells poultry, mainly turkey. The whole idea belongs to her mother-in-law, who has had a good experience raising poultry. Peak sales of turkey were on New Year’s Eve. The revenue raised from sales helped the family obtain a nice gift of furniture for the house. Gulumkan succeeded to increase returns up to 25,000 soms and have 4,000 soms of income per month. Gulumkan’s diligence and patience have paid off. Now she applies for a loan from Kiva with the purpose of buying some more turkey for further reselling.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase turkeys.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen V., 57, resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. She sells traditional cakes, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 15 on other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a tuk tuk for her nephew to start a business as a tuk tuk driver. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a tuk tuk for her nephew to start a business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley Kenya. He has been in the dairy business for two years now and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to the local market.

He has requested a loan of 25,000KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  The extra income from this loan will enable him to meet the basic needs of his family. In future, he would like to buy land and plant more pasture and also improve the quality of his dairy cows. He faces the challenge of poor infrastructure and lack of enough animal feeds.

Charles is 21 years old and married with one child who is two years old now.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy, 38, is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift valley Kenya. He is married with four children who are between the ages of eight and sixteen years. All the children attend school. He has been practicing dairy farming for ten years now and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to the local market and to a nearby tea estate.

He has requested a loan of 50,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this dairy cow will increase his security for future loans and increase his income through the sale of milk. He would like to buy land to plant more pasture in the next five years. His primary challenges are poor infrastructure, lack of enough animal feeds and lack of professional services like artificial insemination.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift valley Kenya. He has been in the dairy business for ten years now and employs two farmhands. He sells his milk to a local tea estate. He is also a businessman and earns income from his small-scale farming of tea.

Kenneth is 34 years old and married with four children who are between the ages of two and eight years. 

He has requested a loan of 50,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The profits from the sale of milk will help him pay school fees for his children. He would like to build a modern dairy unit in the next five years and improve the quality of his dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat resides in Multan which is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and famous for its shrines and hot weather. She lives there in a two room brick house in the area of Yaqoob town with her family. She came here 15 years ago.

A talented lady, Nusrat operates an embroidery business from her home where she completes the orders of embroidery of her neighborhood clients and earns an income for her family. She is very good in her skills and crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes which attract more customers. 

Her husband is a private entrepreneur who runs a cigarette and pan (betel leaf) shop in the market and serves his customers. Nusrat and her husband work very hard to fulfill the basic needs of the family.

Nusrat has 5 sons. Her eldest son works in a small restaurant while younger one makes furniture and others stay at home. Nusrat couldn’t provide education to her sons due to poor financial conditions but she is thankful to God that her elder children are doing work to financially support the family. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will put more brands of cigarettes and pan (betel leaf) in his shop for selling.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes and pan (betel leaf) to sell.

loans.name: Gulzyina's Group

texts.en:
Gulzyina K. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Balykchi, a small town in Isykul region. She is 55 and married. Together with her husband she has raised two sons and three daughters. The youngest daughter studies at university and the other children are employed. Two older daughters are married and live separately with their families.  Gulzyina used to work at the meat processing and packing factory. But then she started her own business, and started to sell fruits and vegetables on the market. In this way she earns 10,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, Gulzyina wants to see her youngest daughter get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick, 24, is married with one child who is two years old now. He has been practicing mixed farming for two years now and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to the local market and local hotels. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea and also depends on the income from his salary to cater for the needs of his family.

He has requested a loan of 30,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo t purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from the sale of milk will be used to provide for the basic needs of his family. He would like to acquire more dairy cows in future and build a modern dairy cow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a talented lady who operates a hand embroidery business at her home to supplement the income of her family. She is known among her community for the quality of her work. This helps her to receive good number of orders every month. She doesn’t have any children, that’s why the income she earns from her business is saved for her old age.

Her husband’s name is A. and he has a barber shop in the market. Through his shop he offers hair cutting and hair dressing services to his customers. He has been in this business for the past 15 years and he has a good number of customers. 

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy scissors, shampoos, and hair gel for his barber shop. By doing this he will be able to provide better quality services and attracts many more clients.

Shahnaz is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and he will be able to make more income than before. She is a new loan user of Asasah. She belongs to Yaqoob town which is a small residential area in the city of Multan. Multan is a historic city of Pakistan and known for its shrines & hot weather. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy scissors, shampoo and hair gel for the barber shop.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Robinson has a mixed farm in Litein town, Rift valley Kenya that produces tea and pineapples. He has been in the farming business for six years now and employs one farmhand. He is also employed as a driver.

He has requested a loan of 50,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. His major challenges are lack of enough animal feeds and diseases which affects his production.

Robinson is 28 years old and married with one child who attends school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna, 33 years old, is from the town of Trinidad. She is 33 years old and married. She owns a small sari-sari store located just at the front of her house. She sells various kinds of products, including toothpaste and detergent soaps. Meraluna opened her store a year ago. She also helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops at their farm. Meraluna hopes for her family to be happy and healthy always.

Meraluna needs additional products to sell at her store. She applied for a loan of 4,000 PHP from CEVI, an MFI that she joined recently. She will use the loan to buy products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara K. is the treasurer of this group. She is the resident of Balykchi, a small town in Isykul region. She is 30 and married. She has three daughters, the first daughter is at school and the others are not yet, they are of preschool age (under seven).

In order to earn money to cover family expenses Gulnara and her husband breed livestock. By reselling livestock animals after fattening them, they earn 10,000 soms per month. This profit makes it possible for them to improve the family’s living conditions and purchase household appliances. Gulnara hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase building materials in order to repair the pavilion, which she installed near her house. In the future she wants to provide her daughters good education and purchase an apartment in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan).

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase building materials.

loans.name: Nurzhamal

texts.en:
Nurzhamal E. was born in Republic of Tadjikistan. Her low-income family with six children earned their living through agriculture and, from early childhood, she helped her parents in this household and looked after her younger siblings. Nurzhamal got married at the age of 19 and gave birth to six children. 

In 1993, Nurzhamal’s family decided to move to Kyrgyzstan, to Partsyezd Village, where they bought a house with small plot of homestead land. They used it to grow different sorts of vegetables, which became their main source of income. As time passed by, Nurzhamal started to work as a cleaner and her husband became the teacher at the local school. After her older children got married and left their parents’ house, Nurzhamal move with her family to Voznesenovka Village, where her husband found a job at the juvenile colony located near the village. 

To support her husband and earn additional income for her children, Nurzhamal started her cattle breeding business with initial capital of 2,000 KGS. She worked hard and managed to maintain a farm with six milk cows and three bull calves. Today, she earns about 5,000 KGS each month by selling milk and meat. 

To develop her farm, Nurzhamal has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy cows and sheep. It will allow her to build a huge barn so she can maintain her cattle well. In the future, she dreams of buying a minivan for her family.


Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 58 years old. Gloria is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from gathering and selling seaweeds to the market.

Gloria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Gloria from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, age 38, is married and has 4 school-aged children, all of whom attend school. She is a farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya where she has been farming for twenty years. Her mixed farm produces pineapples, tea, cabbages and milk, which are all sold locally. She also operates a hotel in the same region.

She has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva field partner, to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help pay school fees for her children. She would like to build a zero-grazing unit for her dairy cows in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is an entrepreneur from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has 5 children. Her eldest is 22 years old while the youngest is only 6. Severina owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells products like milk, soap, canned goods and many other things. Severina hopes to expand her store. She says she needs to work hard, especially since 4 of her children go to school now.

Severina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Severina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth and fabric

loans.name: Aliman's Group

texts.en: Aliman B. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Balykchi, a small town in Isykul region. She is 57, married to a carpenter and has a nine-year-old son who studies at school. In order to earn money, Aliman sells apples. In the spring she is going to sell potatoes (she prepared two tons of potatoes for sale). She has been selling fruits and vegetables for 12 years. In this way she earns 50,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more apples for sale. In the future she wants to purchase a family car. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase apples

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is married to M. L. and resides in the city of Multan in Pakistan. Multan city is known for its historic places and hot weather. She owns a two-room house there where she lives with her husband, 5 children and her brother. 

Her husband is a blacksmith by profession and makes iron boxes which are used to keep clothes, bed sheets, blankets, etc. Her brother is involved in an embroidery business. He does embroidery on clothes and gets income. He learned this skill from Nusrat and became expert by helping her in completing her embroidery orders.
 
Nusrat was unable to provide an education for her children, so that’s why they started work at an early age. Her eldest son, who is 20 years of age, makes school bags while her second and third sons make plastic baskets.  Her youngest children are below 10 years of age and they stay at home.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother’s business. With the loan, he will buy embroidery items such as clothes, beads, colored thread and sketches which will help him complete orders on time and make an extra income.

She is a new loan user of Asasah and is hopeful that a loan investment will bring positive changes to her brother’s business and he will be able to save some money from the profits for his marriage.

Note: In the photo, the lady with the raised hand is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for business

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina has been practicing mixed farming for twelve years in Rift Valley, Kenya. Her main products are milk, which she sells to Brookside Company, and tea, which she sells to a local tea factory. She also operates a shop in the same region

She has requested a loan of 65,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva field partner, to purchase a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her acquire a quality dairy cow that will improve her milk production and increase her income. Her biggest challenge has been the fluctuation in the market prices of milk.

Selina is 37 years old and married. She has 3 children between the ages of 2 and 11 years.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 32 years old, married and has 5 children ages 13, 10, 6, 3 and 1. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. Rosa has been engaged in fishing for 9 years now.

Rosa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. loans.name: Mutai

texts.en:
Mutai is a dairy farmer from Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been in the dairy business for 5 years and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk at the local market and a local tea estate. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea.

Mutai is 39 years old and married. His four school-aged children all attend school.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva field partner, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help meet the basic needs of his family. He plans to acquire a high-yield dairy cow in the next five years. His major challenge has been lack of funds to expand his farming activities.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Catarin

texts.en:
Catarin has been practicing mixed farming in Litein in the Rift Valley of Kenya for over 30 years. Her mixed farm produces milk, tea and maize, which are all sold locally. She also operates a hotel in the same region.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva field partner, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve her family's living standards. Her biggest challenge has been lack of clean water for her dairy cows.

Catarin is 55 years old and married. She has 8 children between the ages of 13 and 40. Two of the children currently attend school.

loans.name: 72- Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Lưu P. Thị (104) is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Lưu is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 72 Quảng Hưng (18-3-72 Quảng Hưng).

Lưu is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Lưu owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products in the local community, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Lưu has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lưu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lưu is requesting a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women for the first time. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Lưu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. Thị Thân (107) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  N. Thị Oanh (103) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  H. Thị Hằng (105) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


4.  P. Thị Tươi (106) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lưu P. Thị (104) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Lưu là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 72 Quảng Hưng  (18-3-72 Quảng Hưng).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Lưu thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lưu kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Lưu đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lưu đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Thân (107) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. Thị Oanh (103) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  H. Thị Hằng (105) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  P. Thị Tươi (106) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz M. H. is married and has five children: four sons and a daughter. Her husband is M. H., a street hawker who sells fruit from his four-wheeled cart along different streets of the city. The family is from Multan, famous in Pakistan for its shrines and hot weather. They live in the neighborhood of Kher-abad in a two-room brick house. Shahnaz moved here after her marriage.

For the past five years Shahnaz has operated a boutique, which she runs to supplement the family’s income. She displays stitched and embroidered clothes in her boutique to attract customers. She has a good number of customers from neighboring areas and also from the cloth markets, who give her regular orders every month.

Shahnaz’s two elder sons work with her and help in expanding her boutique business. They collect orders for her from different shops in the markets, and Shahnaz completes them on time to earn an income.

Shahnaz has applied for a loan, her first from Kiva’s partner Asasah, for her boutique. She is confident that an investment will definitely put her business into a more profitable position. With the loan she will buy clothes, patterns, and thread in bulk, which will help her in making more dresses and increasing her income.

loans.use: To buy clothes, patterns, and thread in bulk
