loans.name: Talaat

texts.en: Talaat is a 21-year-old young man from Hebron. Talaat studies mechanical engineering. He graduates next semester and will start working on his graduation project and final seminar. Talaat came to FATEN for a loan to pay for last semester's tuition fees as well as purchase all the items needed for his graduation project. Talaat's brother is a Palestinian National Authority employee, who will help him pay back the loan until he graduates and starts working. Talaat appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: For university tuition fees

loans.name: 71-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Oanh N. Thị (7) is a 20-year-old woman who lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. Oanh is the leader of a 7-member loan group sponsored by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 71-Quảng Hưng (18-6-71 Quảng Hưng ).

Oanh is married and has one young child. To making a living, Oanh raises and sells pigs. Oanh has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4248000 VND to buy piglets to raise and sell in the future. This will be Oanh's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Oanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. N. Thị Vui (12) is a 45 year-old woman who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

2. N. Thị Thắng (10) is a 47 year-old woman who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

3. Hà Thị Lài (13) is a 62 year-old woman who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her livestock business.

4. T. Thị Ánh (9) is a 36 year-old woman who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

5. N. Thị Tâm (8) is a 56 year-old woman who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her livestock business.

6. N. Thị Hồ (11) is a 37 year-old woman who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her butcher shop.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Oanh N. Thị (7) là 20 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Thanh Hoá. Oanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các tH.nh viên. Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 71-Quảng Hưng (18-6-71 Quảng Hưng).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. Oanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Oanh kiếm được khoảng 1000000 VND. Vào 2010, Oanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Oanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.   Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1. N. Thị Vui (12) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2. N. Thị Thắng (10) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3. Hà Thị Lài (13) là 62 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4. T. Thị Ánh (9) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5. N. Thị Tâm (8) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6. N. Thị Hồ (11) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa H.ng T.t.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Lolita Benavente's Group

texts.en:
Lolita lives in the village of Cogon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, married, has three school-aged children and leads a five-person loan group affiliated with PMPC. While each member of Lolita B.’s group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
 
To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a hog-raising business. She has been in this line of work for more than two years and earns about 1,500 a month. In 2009, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC and plans to use her 4,000 PHP portion of this new group loan to buy more piglets to raise and later sell. She plans to use the additional revenue she earns from this loan to continue expanding her business.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and later sell

loans.name: Letecia Cartajenas Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Letecia C. is 55 years old, married and lives in Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City. She leads a two-person loan group affiliated with PMPC. While each member gets an individual loan, both are responsible for paying back the entire loan if the other member is delinquent or defaults.

Letecia's husband makes a living driving a truck. They have five children, all of them grown. Five years ago, Letecia joined Paglaum MPC as a way to improve her life and ability to engage in business. She will use her 14,000 PHP portion of this new loan, her third, for truck maintenance and franchising. She will use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions, set aside some savings and continue expanding her small business. 

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. 
About Group Loans
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.name: Annie Sumalpong's Group

texts.en:
Annie S. is from Cogon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old and married with one school-age child. She is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by PMPC. The official name of this borrowing group is Annie S.’s Group. 

To make a living, Annie sells fish. She has been engaged in her business for almost a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Annie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP for additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC and is is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP for additional inventory and working capital. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, and as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion.

Nelly P. is from the barangay of Catadman, city of Ozamis. She is 50 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Nelly has a carenderia (a small restaurant) and vulcanizing (auto parts) shop. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

This will be the second loan taken out by Nelly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Naseem is still working on furnishing his house, as he is an employee and couldn't furnish the whole house when he decided to get married. He is an employee in a trading company. 

Naseem took out a loan from FATEN to furnish the girls' room and paint it. Naseem appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma is married to M. S. and operates a sewing business to share the financial burden with her husband. She started this business three years ago because her husband was not able to meet the basic needs of the family alone. Her husband is a private entrepreneur who sells fruit from his four-wheeled cart, visiting different areas of the community. Najma helps him by arranging the fruit on his cart early in the morning. She has given birth to two daughters and a son. Her daughters are studying while her son is 10 years old and stays at home. Najma lives in a small residential area of Multan known as Kher abad. Multan is a big city in Pakistan known for its shrines and hot weather. She has lived there in a two-room brick house for the past 15 years.

Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine which will help her finish orders on time and produce quality work. She is very hopeful that the investment will bring good results for her business and improve her profits. This is her first loan application to Asasah and she hopes it will result in a long-term relationship.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is currently in a business of selling beans, rice, charcoal and alcohol. She is 30 years old, married to a businessman, with seven children — five of them go to school. The loan is to stock more beans, rice, charcoal and alcohol. With the extra profits, Joice hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more beans,rice, charcoal, and alcohol.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans, age 48, is married and has three children between the ages of 14 and 22. He is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya where he has been farming for 20 years. His main products are milk, maize, beans and sorghum, all of which are sold locally. 

He has requested a loan of 61,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva field partner, to purchase and insure a dairy cow and start a poultry project. The extra income from this loan will improve his family's livelihood and help him pay school fees for his children. Low market prices for milk and diseases have been his main challenges.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and to start a poultry project.

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar lives in Multan which is a big city in Pakistan, known for its shrines and hot weather. She has been living there with her family in the area of Kher Abad in a 2-room brick house for over 24 years. She is a caring lady, who prefers to stay at home and carry out her duties as a housewife. She is also good at hand embroidery. She learnt this skill from her mother. She makes hand embroidery when she finds herself free from household work. She does this work part time. The money she earns helps her fulfill the basic needs of her family. 

Her husband’s name is M. R. and he is a loader by profession. He uses his horse cart for his business and loads different items such as fruits & vegetables and construction supplies on it and earns a good income by dropping the load at the destinations.  

Munawar is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her elder son is a rickshaw driver while her younger son works at a petrol pump for a low income.  Her daughters are attending school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to dispose of his  current business because it requires great physical effort and sometimes he gets work and sometimes not, so he will buy a rickshaw with the loan amount. The rickshaw will help him to serve many passengers and earn a good income for his family.  

Munawar is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her husband and he will successfully operate his new business.  She is new loan user of Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Munawar.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a twenty five year old married man with two children living in a rented house in Fort portal Uganda with an ambition of building a permanent house for residence. For two years he has been into piggery, started with five pigs and now has fifty pigs and his goal is to have at least a hundred pigs. Geoffrey needs the loan facility to buy pigs.

loans.use: Buying pigs

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 36-year-old married man, father of three boys, Mahmoud 10 years old, Jamal 9 years old and Abdullah one month old, living and working in Saida. Ali has owned a laboratory in Saida for 14 years; his work is good but the main problem he's facing is the unsolved issue of electricity. His work is delayed because of this problem and he doesn't want to be late with his clients, as this might lead them to search for another laboratory in the future. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a generator necessary to speed up his business, which should lead to business improvement and increase in income. He aims to provide a good living for his three boys, in addition to high educational levels. He hopes he can open a wider and more professional lab in the future where he can add new examinations such as X-rays and 3D.

loans.use: To buy a generator for his laboratory

loans.name: Clevers

texts.en:
Clevers A. is 48 years old and married with eight children; six attend school. He is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya where he has been farming for 25 years. His mixed farm produces milk, maize and beans that are all sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater to the basic needs of his family. His biggest challenges have been the fluctuation in the market price of milk and the high cost of dairy cow feed particularly during the dry season.

Clevers has requested a loan of 62,400 KES through Kiva’s partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children. He would like to build a zero grazing unit [cows are kept confined to stalls to more easily maintain their health, etc. while allowing surrounding land to restore itself] so that he could manage his animals better and also improve his productivity in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en: Edreda is fifty-one years old, a single mother of six children, living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a retail shop and a bar and has been running it for four years after farming. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop and her hardship is limited capital. Edreda needs the loan to buy sugar, salt, and rice for resale.

loans.use: Buying sugar, salt, and rice for resale

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion is a thirty-year-old married woman with one child living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a family dream of building her own residential home. She has been in the motorcycle business for two years and the business seems to be worth the venture after she changed over from a retail shop. Her aspiration is to own at least three motorcycles. Marion needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Farzana Ghulam Jaffer's Group

texts.en:
Farzana G. J. is married to G. J., who works for a private organization for a low wage. She has given birth to three sons, all of whom are below ten years of age. The family lives in Multan, one of the biggest cities in Pakistan and known for its shrines. Farzana has been living there with her family in the neighborhood of Kher Abad in a two-room brick house for the past ten years. When not working, she gives all of her time to her children and husband. She is very active and performs her daily household work well.

Farzana is a seamstress who receives orders from neighboring clients. She has been in business for over five years. She is an expert in her work and can sew designer and non-designer clothes very easily. She sews clothes with utmost concentration and gives her best to each dress. Her clients are very satisfied with her work and give her regular orders every month. She does this work to share the family’s financial burden with her husband.

Farzana has applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva’s partner Asasah to improve her sewing business. With the loan she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her continue to produce quality work and make more income. Farzana is very hopeful that such an investment will bring good profits to her and that she will be able to provide a better standard of living for her family.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah passbook) is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Stephenson

texts.en:
Stephenson is a twenty-seven-year old married man with five children. He owns his own home. 

Stephenson dreams of setting up an income-generating venture for his family. He is into motorcycle transport and has been in business for three successful years. His problems include mechanical breakdown and customers dictated by the seasons. Nevertheless, Stephenson wishes to own another motorcycle, and for this he would need a loan.

loans.use: Purchasing  a motorcycle

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a thirty-four-year-old married man with three children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating his children. For ten years he has been farming tea. He started by hiring land and now has his own. His main challenge is lack of enough funds and his future plan is to plant twenty more acres of tea.

loans.use: Planting tea

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a natural juice selling business for the past three years, sellling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Zainabu faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy winter season the demand for natural juice is low compared to the hot summer season. Zainabu hopes to establish rental houses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a compressor for making natural juices for sale. She decided to work with Yehu because of its good reputation in her society.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor for making natural juices for sale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David K., 43, is married with five school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for eighteen years. His mixed farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables that are all sold in the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater to the needs of his family.

He has requested a loan of 51,600 KES through Kiva’s partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Zabayo Group

texts.fr: Kiroha S.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Zabayo, âgée de 47 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants.  Son conjoint est un enseignant. Elle fait le petit commerce de vente de  boissons (Primus et boissons locales) à son domicile. Elle fait également l’agriculture.  Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ au début de  2010. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (5 casiers de Primus, 6 bidons de boissons locales mandrakwa) et la location de lopin de terre de 2 hectares à cultiver). En plus, elle ambitionne construire confortablement une maison dans le quartier populaire Majengo. La cliente Kiroha S.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Zabayo est constitué de 31 membres.
texts.en: Kiroha S. is an entrepreneur and the leader of the group named Zabayo. She is 47 years old and she is the mother of 9 children. Her partner is a teacher. She has a small business selling drinks (Primus and local drinks) from her home. She is also an agriculturist. She started out her business with her own money, given to her by her husband. She received a loan from IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of $50 in early 2010. This new loan will help her buy more products (5 boxes of Primus, 6 tubs of a local drink called mandrakwa) and to buy 2 hectares of land to cultivate. Additionally, she hopes to comfortably build a house in the popular quarter of Majengo. Kiroha S. is grateful to Hekima for their actions towards the poor who are excluded from traditional banks. The Zabayo group is made up of 31 members.

loans.use: To purchase drinks for resale and 2 hectares of land to cultivate.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Tosheka Group

texts.fr: Kahindo K.  est entrepreneur, vice présidente du groupe Tosheka, âgée de 52 ans, veuve, mère de 9 enfants.  Son mari fut décédé suite à une  maladie inopinée. La cliente Kahindo K.  est vendeuse des braises (charbon de bois). En  l’an 2000, elle  commença son business  avec un fonds  reçu de son ami sous forme d’une assistance non remboursable de 35$. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Elle installe ses produits au marché sectoriel Alanine - Katindo. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  9 sacs des braises  pour augmenter son stock en volume et en valeurs.  En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et construire confortablement pour ses enfants.  La cliente Kahindo K.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Tosheka est constitué de 30 membres.
texts.en: Kahindo K. is an entrepreneur and the vice-president of the group named Tosheka. She is 52 years old and she is the mother of 9 children. Her husband passed away from a sudden illness. Kahindo K. sells charcoal (wood coal). In 2000, she started her business with money she received from her husband, a $35 allowance. She later approached IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of $50. She displays her products in the neighborhood market of Alanine-Katindo. The new loan will help her purchase 9 sacks of charcoal to increase the volume of her inventory and its value. Additionally, she hopes to purchase a parcel of land to build a comfortable dwelling for her children. Kahindo K. is grateful to Hekima for their actions towards the poor who are excluded from traditional banks. The Tosheka group is made up of 30 members.

loans.use: To purchase 9 sacks of charcoal.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is twenty-eight years old, a single mother of one child living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a desire to educate her child. For three years she has been operating a bar and her major challenge is the unpredictable nature of customers while her dream is to own a bigger bar in town. Elizabeth needs the loan to buy beers and sodas for sale.

loans.use: Buying beers and sodas for sale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is from the village of Disud. She is 48 years old. Jocelyn is a group member of PMPC. Jocelyn is married and has 3 children; only one is still studying. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business selling different products in the local community.  

Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for 6 months and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon is a fifty-nine-year-old married man with four children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been selling maize for over twenty years and with this business he has been able to educate his children. His hardship is the seasonal nature of the business and his dream is to have at least a hundred sacks of maize. Benon needs the loan to purchase sacks of maize.

loans.use: Purchasing sacks of maize

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia is 48-year-old married woman with five children. She started as a farmer and raised capital which she used to start up a crafts business in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. She hopes to change her business to a retail shop and educate her children. She wants a loan to buy craft materials.

loans.use: to buy craft materials

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat lives in Multan, a big city located in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her family in the area of Kher abad in a 2-room brick house. She came here 10 years ago. Nusrat is married and has 3 daughters and a son. She is unable to provide education to her children due to poor financial conditions. Her husband is a daily wage laborer. His income is not guaranteed every day because sometimes he gets work and sometimes not.

That is why Nusrat started her boutique business 5 years ago to financially support her husband in fulfilling the family's basic needs. Nusrat collects orders from her neighborhood clients and completes them on time to earn income. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to further improve her boutique business. With the loan, she will purchase embroidery material such as clothes, beads and colored thread in bulk, which will help her make more embroidered dresses to sell to her customers. Nusrat is very hopeful that an investment will help her develop her boutique business further and enable her to send her younger children to school in the near future. Nusrat is a new loan applicant with Asasah. Note: In the photo, Nusrat is holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy embroidery items for her boutique business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard wants a loan to buy more drugs for his shop. He is a 32-year-old married clinical officer with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a permanent rented house. He dreams of educating his children, increasing his sources of income and upgrading his drug shop to the pharmacy level.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell in his shop

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Otgonbaatar is 24 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in his in-laws’ small house, in the outer ger districts of the city. His wife studied at university with a concentration in tourism. 

Otgonbaatar has been supporting his family by operating a taxi business for the past three years. In 2008, he started his taxi business using a car which he bought on a leasing contract from another person. He repaid the leasing contract over 16 months. During the past three years, he has been able to gradually improve his living conditions and has gained a lot of experience. He is planning to sell his old car and purchase another secondhand car, due to safety regulations for transportation. He is requesting a 2,750,000 MNT loan to purchase the secondhand car. His goal is to improve his living conditions by buying an apartment, and then he wants to have children and a happy life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand car

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 21-year-old woman from Sanour village, next to Jenin, in Palestine. Amani is a student. She took out a loan from FATEN to pay for last semester's tuition fees. Amani's father and brother will help her pay back the loan. Amani wants to find a job after graduation and have an independent source of income. Amani's brother is a NationA. Palestinian Authority employee.

Amani's brother, Hakam, appears in the picture here as she is a religious woman.

loans.use: To pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina P. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 29 years old and married. Gina owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gina works hard to provide for her family.

Gina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nyansio

texts.en: Forty-year-old Nyansio would like a loan to pay his school fees. He is a salary earner. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a rented house. He desires to have his children educated and to build a residential house.

loans.use: to pay his school fees

loans.name: Silver

texts.en: Silver, 30 years old, is a married man living in a permanent house in Kyenjojo Uganda. He rents banana plantations and sells the bananas. He has done this for five years. He dreams of building a permanent residential house and having his own plantations. He wants a loan to rent a banana plantation.

loans.use: To rent a banana plantation.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are house rent and school fees.

Rehema has operated a car hire business for the past three years, passengers being her potential customers. Rehema faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She want to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase tires to repair her cars. She decided to work with Yehu because of its good reputation in her society.She hopes to build her own home in the future.

loans.use: To purchase car tires to repair her cars for hire

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice, aged thirty-three, would like a loan to buy land.  She lives in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda, and owns a retail shop.  Alice dreams of building a good house and expanding her business.

loans.use: Purchase  of  land

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To build on her land

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Otgonjargal is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children, aged 7 to 18 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house in the outer ger districts of the city. Her oldest son studies at high school and her daughter and younger son attend secondary and primary school. Her daughter is preparing for the International Mathematics Olympics and she is a top student. 

Otgonjargal is in charge of operating the small food store in her family’s yard with regular help from her husband.  The grocery store is in a small cabin that must be kept warm by constantly keeping a fire burning in the winter.

In 2003, when she first began operating a business, she served  customers with a telephone service at an outdoor market. In 2005, she and her husband together built a small house and she opened a small grocery store. Her store sells candies, bakery products, purified water, juices, breads, vegetables and other small foods. Besides food trading she also sells small bags of firewood and coal. 

In 2010, her family bought a small truck with her business earnings. Now, her husband sells coal and firewood from the truck. With this loan of 800,000 MNT, Otgonjargal’s family wants to expand their food store to sell a wider variety of foods, firewood and coal before the Mongolian Lunar New Year Holiday. 

In the future, Otgonjargal wants to expand the store’s size.  Her goal is to improve her children education, so her children can become very smart in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of food products to sell in the grocery store

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en: Adolf would like a loan to purchase general merchandise such as maize, beans and millet to resell. He runs a retail shop. He is a married man with ten children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of building a residential house and educating his children. His business dream is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans & millet to resell

loans.name: Nematulloi

texts.ru: Неъматуллои Бухори проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 28 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей на рынке Мехргон. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает мужскую одежду. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Nematulloi B., 28, lives in Yavan with his wife and two children. He has secondary education. He makes a living by selling male clothes at the Mehrgon market where he rents a stall. Having been in this business for six years, Nematulloi is applying for a loan in order to increase the assortment of goods.

loans.use: to increase assortment

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 29-year-old married mother of 2 children.  She lives in a rented house in Hioma, Uganda. She takes care of the family's welfare and lives in a family of 4 people.  Her goal is to build a permanent house.

Sylvia has a secretarial service business which she has been running for 3 years. She started it with 2 computers but now has 3 computers and a photocopier.  In her business, she faces a challenge in the high cost of electricity and its unreliability. She hopes to grow her business bigger in future.  Sylvia needs a loan to stock up on stationery.

loans.use: To stock stationery

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with grown children. He is a small business entrepreneur from Kahovka. Alexander sells women’s footwear in the local marketplace. He was forced to launch his own venture due to financial hardships in the family. Alexander has been in this trade for 14 years. Presently, his turnover capital amounts to 28,000 Grivnyas. His net profit is 7,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Alexander is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to increase his working capital. He is hopeful that with hard work, determination, and financial assistance, his business will continue to be successful and provide himself and his family with a stable, long-term income.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia has a business selling beans, fish, etc. at a food stall.  She has requested a loan to stock more beans, fish, etc. to sell. She is 36 years old, married to a businessman, and has  9 children  – only 4 of her children go to school. With the extra profits, Cicilia hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more beans, fish, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sabanor Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Sabanor” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mohamed J. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of this group. This forty-five-year-old is married to a businesswoman.  They have four children. Mohamed has been a businessman for many years, selling chocolates, sweets, mints, sardines, books, etc. With his share of this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to his current inventory.

loans.use: To buy products at wholesale price to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.fr: Kabumba I.  est entrepreneur, trésorière du groupe Maombi, âgée de 35 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants, tous ces enfants étudient confortablement.  Son conjoint est un maitre charpentier, ouvrier  indépendant.  La cliente Kabumba I. est vendeuse des poissons frais au long des rues ambiantes. Elle commença son business  avec son fonds propre. Depuis 1994, elle exerce cette même activité. Elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ en 2005. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits  (4 paniers de poissons frais) pour revendre.  En plus, elle ambitionne,  elle-même allé s’approvisionner les poissons en Ouganda-Kisoro sans passer par les intermédiaires. La cliente Kabumba I.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Maombi est constitué de 31 membres.
texts.en: Kabumba Immaculee is an entrepreneur and she is also the treasurer of the group named Maombi. She is 35 years old, she is married, and she is the mother of 6 children. All of her children are in school. Her husband is a master carpenter and an independent tradesman. Kabumba Immaculee sells fresh fish along the locale roads. She started her business with her own money. She has had this same business since 1994. She accessed a loan of $50 in 2005 from IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner). This new loan will help her purchase more products (4 baskets of fresh fish) for resale. In addition, she hopes to travel to Ouganda-Kisoro to purchase fish without having to buy from retailers. Kabumba Immaculee is grateful to Hekima for their actions towards the poor who are otherwise excluded from traditional banks. The Maombi group is made up of 31 members.

loans.use: To purchase 4 baskets of fish.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is house rent.  She hopes to establish her own home in the future.

Mishi has been operating a retail shop business for the past three years, selling to her neighbors. Mishi faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands in her business. During the holiday season, the demand for goods is higher than during the months of January to May,  when the demand is low. 

With the Kshs 80,000 loan, she wants to purchase 2 bags of sugar, beans, rice, 10 bags of charcoal, and a dairy cow. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, beans, rice, charcoal, and a dairy cow

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen N. is 45 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school. Stephen has a mixed farm in Nyamira town, western Kenya that produces tea, milk, vegetables and maize that are all sold locally. He has been in the farming business for eighteen years now. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater to the basic needs of his family.

Stephen has requested a loan of 35,000 KES through Kiva’s partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's living conditions. He would like to expand his tea plantation and own at least four dairy cows in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Self Help Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Self Help” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each person. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Ya Marie K. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of this group. She is 45 years old and is married to a building contractor.   Together they have six children. Ya Marie has been a businesswoman for nine years, selling sardines, powdered milk, soaps, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: To buy sardines, powdered milk, soaps, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Metrine

texts.en:
Metrine is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

She has been operating her business for the past two years, selling clothes and detergents from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Metrine faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands in her business. During the rainy winter season, the demand for heavy clothing is high compared to the hot summer season. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase two bundles of clothes and detergents for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase clothes & detergents to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy car parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy palm oil

loans.name: Nosheen's Group

texts.en:
Nosheen is married to M. A..  She operates a decorative embroidery business to support her family financially. She has been doing this work for the past 7 years and has a good number of clients in her community. 

Nosheen's husband is a painter by profession and paints on houses and walls on order.  It is very difficult for Nosheen to manage her household expenses but she never compromises on her children’s education. She has 3 children and all of them are studying. 

Nosheen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her embroidery business. With this loan, she will buy embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and tassels in bulk to fulfill larger orders and make more income. She is very hopeful that she will successfully be able to improve the financial condition of her business after the loan investment.  

Nosheen is a regular loan user of Asasah's.  This is her 2nd loan application.  With the previous loan, she established good credit behavior and had never missed a meeting.   

Nosheen lives in Multan, a big city in Pakistan known for its shrines and hot weather. She came here after her marriage and lives in a 2-room brick house in the area of Samejabad. 

Note:  In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Nosheen.

loans.use: To buy materials for embroidery business

loans.name: Lion Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim T. (first row left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Ibrahim was born in Yele village about thirty years ago. He is married to a businesswoman.  The couple has two children who are not yet of school-going age. 

For over six years, Ibrahim has been selling market food – palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, pepper, etc.   This is the first loan that Ibrahim and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Ibrahim will use his share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand his business.  He will buy palm oil, rice, pepper, kola nuts, etc. at wholesale to add to his inventory.

loans.use: To buy palmoil, rice, pepper, kola nuts, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wood and a cutting machine to use in a souvenirs workshop

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
Merina N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Merina changed her business from a retail shop to selling local gin.  She has been in this business for a few months, working 6 days out of every week. Merina sells her products from home by means of retail.    She also generates additional income through a retail shop. 

Merina has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerry cans of local gin. The main business challenges for Merina include the rainy season, transportation, and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations are to be a local gin agent and to educate her children up to university.   

Merina lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy local gin

loans.name: Just Try Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Just Try” group. They are small businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Musu Tailor, who is pictured in the back row on the left.  Musu is thirty-two-years old.  She was born in Solima, in southern Sierra Leone. Musu is currently residing in Makeni with her husband and three children. 

For fifteen years,  Musu has been selling palm oil, rice, cigarette, matches, mints, biscuits, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her inventory.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, cigarette, matches, mints, biscuits, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel N. M. is fifty two years old.  He is married to a business woman.  They have four children aged between twenty-five and eighteen.  They hope to give their children a good education to the university level. 

Samuel operates a matatu which he uses to provide transport on the Kakamega-Kisumu route. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for the production of sugarcanes – it is known as the sugar belt region.  Samuel has been running this business for the last two years and has managed to provide employment for two people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is competition. He says that there are many people offering the same service as his, reducing the amount of profit they can make per day. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Samuel is using this loan of Kes 20,000 to buy spare parts to repair his vehicle to enable him to improve his business. He hopes to buy more transport vehicles in the future to service different routes. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repair vehicle

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina N. lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.   

Madina has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Madina   sells her products at the market by means of wholesale as well as retail.   She also generates additional income through a grocery shop.

Madina has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  The main business challenges for Madina include the rainy season, transportation, and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations are to start selling wholesale only, buy a plot of land to build her own house, and educate her children up to university.   

Madina lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a clothes selling business for the past six months, selling from home to her neighbors. Mariam faces a major challenge in competition from other clothes sellers. She hopes to expand and establish a shop in the future. 

With the loan for Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of Leso's (Khanga's) for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Turana

texts.ru:
Turana I. 24 qoda. Ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Turana yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjara i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Turana zokonchila universitet i teper uje 2 qoda kak rabotayet uchitelnicey. Turana ochen lubit svoyu robotu i detey, lubit ix uchit obyasnyat im vse. 
Turana seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit knigi i testi kotoriye stoyat ochen doroqo, i mnoqiye deti ne imeyut vozmojnosti ix pokupat.
texts.en:
Turana I. is 24 years old. She is single, without children. Turana is an Internally Displaced Person, a refugee from Kalbajar now living in the Absheron Region together with her family. Turana has graduated fromt eh university and  it is now two years since she has been working as a school teacher. Turana really loves her work. She loves children and enjoys teaching them and explaining things to them. 

At present Turana needs 2000 AZN in order to purchase books and tests, which are very expensive and unaffordable for many children.

loans.use: Purchasing necessary books and tests

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista K. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Teopista has a business selling roasted maize.  She has been in this business for 7 years, working 7 days out of every week.  She also generates additional income through selling tomatoes.

Teopista   sells her products from home by means of wholesale and retail.    Teopista has requested a loan of 700000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of maize and baskets of tomatoes.   The main business challenges for Teopista include the rainy season, transportation, and seasonality of demands.  Her goals and aspirations are to start growing maize and tomatoes herself and to improve her standards of living.   

Teopista lives in a home that she rents.  She doesn't have access to electricity nor to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and rent.

loans.use: To buy maize and tomatoes

loans.name: Buri

texts.ru: Нодиров Бури проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 61 года. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Сын на заработках в России. Сам Бури более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. В этом ему помогает жена. На сегодняшний день у него имеется три коровы и два теленка. Его семья обеспечена молоком и молочными продуктами. Еще он занимается продажей молока. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Buri N. lives in the region of Yavan. He is 61 years old. He is married and has five children. His son is working in Russia. Buri has been doing animal  husbandry for more than ten years. He breeds cattle at home for future resale. His wife helps him in this business. Currently he has three cows and two calves. His family is supplied with milk and milk products. Buri also sells the milk. He is taking out the loan to buy large cattle and increase their quantity.

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy M. M. is 33 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman and they have two children between ten years old and four years old. They hope to give them a good education to the university level. Her business is located at Kakamega town. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugarcane and it is known as the sugar belt region. She has been selling shoes to the local people for the last six years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is the fact that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers and so customers are not loyal because they are spoiled by the choices. She also says that the purchasing power of the people in the area is low, leading to slow movement of stock. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more shoes to expand her business and meet the various tastes of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to wholesale in the future. She also sees herself purchasing a plot of land. She describes herself as a very hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Kamran

texts.ru:
Kamran Amirovu rodilsya v 1950 qodu . On jenat i imeyet 4 detey. Kamran yavlyayestya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione. Kamran uje 13 let kak rabotayet taxistom. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Kamrana v perviy raz on bral 1200 $ i za eto on blagodarel Kive i lenderam.
On s toqo vremeni pomenyal svoyu mashinu i seychas Kamran nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki mashini.
texts.en:
Kamran A. was born in 1950. He is married and has four children. Kamran is an Internally Displaced Person, a refugee from the Fuzuli Region now liging in the Absheron Region. For the last 13 years, Kamran has been working as a taxi driver. This is Kamran’s second loan. The first time he took out 1200 USD. He is greateful to Kiva and to the lenders. 

Since then he has changed his car, and now he needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: Purchasing auto spare parts

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad, who is in the picture here, is a 36-year-old man from Jericho. He is the father of two daughters and two sons. Iyad saved money when he was employed to start his own business one day. Now he has enough money and has started a butchery and grocery store.

Iyad needs a small amount of money to purchase a fridge to display meat in the butchery and he will use the rest of the money to purchase goods to sell in the grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a meat display case and goods for a grocery shop

loans.name: Sharifah

texts.en:
Sharifah N. is single and has no children. She lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood of the city of Kampala in a home that she rents. She doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent.

Sharifah upgraded her food stall to a restaurant operated from her home. She has been in the restaurant business for one month, and she works seven days out of every week. The main problems for Sharifah include the rainy season and defaulters.

Sharifah has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice and sweet and Irish potatoes. Her aspiration for her business is to have a fully stocked restaurant and also improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more food for her restaurant

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. is single and has no children, but she does take care of her sister. She lives in the Makerere Kikoni neighborhood in Kampala in a home that she rents. She has no access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding her and her sister.

Hadjah sells charcoal. She has been in this business for ten years and works seven days a week. Hadjah sells her charcoal from home. She also gets some additional income from hiring out her motorcycle. Her main problems include seasonality and defaulters.

Hadjah has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goal is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Islomjon

texts.en:
Islomjon K. is married with six children. He lives in Isfara in Tajikistan.

Islomjon has been in a manufacturing business for 33 years. He takes an individual approach to each client, helping with color, shape and configuration. Little competition and good quality work have resulted in good profits for Islomjon and much positive feedback from his clients.

Islomjon is requesting a loan of 7500 TJS. The loan will allow him to purchase necessary materials, provide his customers with trendy and modern products, and increase the assortment of inventory he offers to his clients. Islomjon takes his loan liabilities very seriously.

About Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich place in history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the farthest reach of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials for his manufacturing needs

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tawopaneh” group. They are small business owners based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sayma K., who is pictured in the first row on the left. Sayma is forty years old.  He was born in Kambia town but currently resides in Makeni with his wife and two children. His wife is a businesswoman.  His children are not yet of school-going age. 

For twenty-five years, Sayma has been selling used clothing. With his share of this loan, he will buy bales of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy used clothes

loans.name: Ilhomiddin

texts.ru: Шарипов Илхомиддин проживает в районе Яван. Ему 38 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Жена, домохозяйка. Брат находится на заработках в России. Сам Илхомиддин занимается животноводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Ilhomiddin S. lives in the region of Yavan. He is 38 years old. He is married and has five children. He lives together with parents. His wife is a homemaker and his brother is working in Russia. Ilhomiddin does animal husbandry. He makes a living by breeding large cattle and has been in this business for six years. He is taking out the loan to buy large cattle.

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Orifkhuja

texts.en:
Orifkhuja is married and has two children. He manufactures wooden objects by hand. He has been in this business for 6 years. Orifkhuja enjoys making objects out of wood and customers recognize his craftsmanship. They order many different things from Orifkhuja. He has very few competitors. This allows his business to be unique and very profitable. 

Orifkhuja would like to receive $3000 USD to purchase materials in bulk for his business. Orifkhuja's work not only gives him and his customers joy but allows him to take good care of his family.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase materials in bulk for woodwork business

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Together As One” group. They are small businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata B.. Fatmata is forty years old.  She was born in one of the villages that make up Sanda, in northern Sierra Leone.   Currently, she resides in Makeni with her husband and children. Her husband is a soldier.  Two of her children are attending primary school, the others (eight of them) no longer attend school. 

For the past five years, Fatmata has been selling beans, cooked cassava roots, sardines, powdered milk, cigarettes, mints, matches, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy beans, cassava roots, sardines, powdered milk, cigarettes, mints, matches, etc.

loans.name: Sobit

texts.en:
Sobit is a farmer. He lives with his wife, 3 school-aged children, and his parents.  His wife helps him care for their land. In the past they have had problems with harvesting and had to sell their crop in advance for reduced earnings.  Over time Sobit has gained a lot of experience in his business and now his crop is one of the most demanded at the market. He currently faces a small problem because his field is infertile, which makes it difficult to grow his crop. To solve this problem, Sobit has decided to request a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to make his field more productive.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Zarifjon

texts.en:
B. Zarifjon is from Gafurov, Tajikistan.  Working with his father, he dedicates himself to his livestock business, a popular enterprise characteristic of this region. He is the father of 3 children, whom he cares for and has the responsibility of educating.  Zarifjon is very conscious of his duty to support his family financially. For this reason, he turned to IMON International to obtain a loan to purchase some pregnant cows to help him increase his income. With your help, Zarifjon will be able to make his business succeed and support his family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand business

loans.name: Madaminjon

texts.en:
E. Madaminjon is a very courageous man who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and agriculture. He is the father of two children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, after much time Madaminjon was able to get ahead through his business of purchasing cattle and breeding them on his property. His greatest goal is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family.  For this reason, Madaminjon came to IMON International for loans to purchase animals for his breeding business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “God Bless” group. They are small businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isatu B.. Isatu is thirty-six years old.  She was born in Kamakwe, a town in northern Sierra Leone.  Currently, she resides in Makeni city with her husband and three children. Her husband is a soldier.  Two of her children are attending primary school and the youngest is not yet of school-going age. 

For the past three years, Isatu has been selling palm oil in gallons and pints. With her share of this loan, she will buy palm oil at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys palm oil at wholesale

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.en:
H. Rahimjon is an ordinary man in the town of Spitamen in Tajikistan. He is a very responsible person and since his youth has been running a livestock farm with the goal of supporting his family  – his wife and two children. 

Rahimjon needs to purchase calves and goats to raise and breed in order to realize profits by selling their milk and meat. Once he has these products from his flock, he sells them in his neighborhood.  In this manner he is able to support his family.  Rahimjon is turning to you for the support that will permit him to continue developing his business.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza has a very good sense of humor.  Her jovial spirit has helped her face difficult times. She has been raising animals since her childhood, and for that reason she decided to remain in this industry. Aziza works very hard to obtain the income to meet her family’s needs. The immense love that she feels from her children and her faithful husband motivates her to keep working hard. She wishes to buy more animals in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
Guljahon is 36 years old. She has a business purchasing and reselling cows. She has two children, who help in her business. Guljahon would like to request a loan of $1500 USD in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and ultimately, greater profit for her family.

In the future, Guljahon would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase more cows and increase her income even further. She plans to use the increased income to fund her children’s education. Guljahon deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: One Word-Ii Group

texts.en:
Kadija B. (pictured in the middle, back row) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadija was born in Makeni city twenty-nine years ago. She is married to a motor bike taxi driver.  The couple has two children who are attending primary schools. For many years now, Kadija has been selling breads. 

This is the first loan that Kadija and her group members have applied for from Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Kadija will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business.  She will buy flour, sugar, salt, etc. in order to produce a large quantity of breads for sale.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to produce breads for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two adult children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is medical bills.

She has been operating a charcoal selling business for the past four years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Grace faces a major challenge of theft in her business because of the insecure area where she operates. She hopes to open a wholesale shop and purchase a boda boda(motorcycle) in the future. 

With this Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a married woman with two children. Her husband is a taxi driver.  Because he does not  earn much income, she started her own business breeding cattle to help support their family. As she had previous experience working on the farm, her business went well. Today Habiba has two cows. She also has enough hay and forage.  She calculated that her fodder is enough for even more cattle, so she decided to take a loan to purchase more cattle. 

Habiba has gained a reputation of being responsible with her financial obligations and for keeping her word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
