loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Rahmonkul

texts.en:
Rahmonkul is a responsible father and loving son. From the time he was young, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Rahmonkul hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.    
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Santigie S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the teachers of the Baptist Model Primary School in Mange village, near Makeni.  The Baptist Primary School was founded in 1976 by the Nigerian Baptist Conference (NBC) to help educate the children of Mange village and free them from a long distance walk to Makeni in search of learning. Currently, the school is staffed with eight teachers and has 285 pupils. 

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from Kiva lenders. Santigie S. K. (second from right) is a teacher at the school and leader of this group of borrowers. The 34-year-old Santigie was born in northern Sierra Leone.  He has been in the teaching profession for nine years. He is married and has five children – two in primary school and three in secondary school. Sanitigie has requested this loan in order to buy building material like iron corrugated zincs.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Hassina

texts.en:
Hassina is a married woman with four children, all of whom are attending school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has been operating a leso and vitenge (kikoi) selling business for the past six years, selling from door to door to her neighbors. Hassina faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands in her business. During the holiday season, the demand for clothes is high compared to the months of January to May. She hopes to open a wholesale shop to sell cloth materials in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of  lesos and vitenges (kikois) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to obtain loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has been operating a butcher shop for the past five years, selling to her neighbors and town dwellers.  In addition, she operates a poultry business, which also contributes to her income. Asha faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands in her business. She hopes to expand and sell wholesale in the future.   

With the loan for Kshs 70,000, she wants to purchase a cow and a goat for meat sale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and a goat for meat sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, fish, potatoes, meat, etc. in large quantity to resell

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: M. kODJO est née le 17 Aout 1977 à Tsevie. Il habite Akodessewa ou il exerce son activité. il est marraichage de profession et a débuté cette activité depuis 2000. Il s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et reevend les légumes sur le boulevard mobutu sesses seko. Il a quatre apprentis qui l'aident dans ses tâches. Pour aggrandir son activité, il sollicite un prêt au près de WAGES.
texts.en: Mr. Kodjo was born on August 17, 1977 in Tsevie. He lives and works in Akodessewa. He is a vegetable farmer he has been doing this work since 2000. he stocks up at the big market in Lomé and resells his vegetables at the Mobutu Sesses Seko boulevard. He has four apprentices who help him out. In order to expand his business, he is seeking a loan from WAGES.

loans.use: Pruchasing seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sabenti Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Sabenti” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small business owners who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each person in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Abdul K.. Abdul was born forty-one years ago in Makump, a village in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has five children. His wife is a businesswoman.  Two of his children are attending primary school, two are in secondary school, and the last is not yet of school-going age. 

Abdul has been selling soaps, batteries, butter, drinks, etc. for the past nine years. With his share of this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy soaps, batteries, butter, drinks, etc.to resell

loans.name: Mawulawoè

texts.fr: Madame Mawulawoè a 41 ans et est mariée. Elle a 3 enfants en charges.Elle est née à vogan et exerce son activité à Nyékonakpoè où elle habite. Elle fait la vente de pagnes au marché local de Nyékonakpoè. Elle a commencé cette activité en 1990 et s'approvisionne au Ghana à Accra. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter de nouveaux lots de pagnes et satisfaire plus de clients. La dame en question est celle qui est assise et habillé en tricot orange et jeans.
texts.en: Ms. Mawulawoè is 41 years old and married. She has three dependent children. She was born in Vogan and works Nyékonakpoè, where she lives. She sells traditional “pagnes” fabric at the local market of Nyékonakpoè. She launched this business in 1990 and stocks up in Accra in Ghana. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase new sets of “pagnes” and be able to serve more customers. She appears in the photo sitting, wearing an orange polo shirt and jeans.

loans.use: Purchasing "pagnes" fabric

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha K. lives in the Nakulabye Kiyaye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  

Aisha operates a beauty salon.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, working 7 days a week.  Aisha has requested loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves.  The main business challenges for Aisha include seasonality and competition.  Her goal/aspiration for her business is to own a bridal salon. 

Aisha lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy cream relaxers, weaves and braids

loans.name: Kulola

texts.en:
Kulola is married with four children, three of whom attend school and one who is still too young. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Kulola’s greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past six years, Kulola has operated a grocery shop, selling goods both door-to-door and from his house. His major business challenge is the high cost of transportation and he hopes to purchase a van for distributing goods. 

Kulola decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost his business. He is requesting a loan of  40,000 KES to purchase supplies of maize, sugar, cabbage and tomatoes.

loans.use: to purchase maize, sugar, cabbage, and tomatoes

loans.name: Ikusasalathu Group

texts.en:
Jabulisiwe is a 50-year-old widowed mother with three children, ages 27-34. She lives in Hlabisa, South Africa (KZN) and runs a retail business selling chickens and renting African skirts for Zulu traditional dances. She is the leader of her borrowing group, and in the photo above she is wearing an orange shirt.

She's been in this business for two years. She sells chicken and eggs from her home. She has two main challenges to her business: she is dependent on traditional dances occurring, and some customers take chickens on credit and do not pay.

She requested this loan through Women's Development Businesses and KIVA to buy beads, black material, and other materials for traditional skirts. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her grandchild to school, pay for her school fees and build a family house. In the future, she would like to see her business grow and add more traditional clothing, like shirts and trousers. She would also like to have a formal place to advertise her business.

She appreciates WDB and Kiva and would like to see WDB and Kiva one day come to her home to see the result of the loan she got from them.

loans.use: To buy beads, black material for skirts, and cotton

loans.name: Pay Back The Money Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Pay Back The Money” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all women who run small businesses and who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, and make more sales and profit. Ultimately, they hope to improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Jariatu S.. Jariatu was born in the eastern city of Kono 32 years ago. She is single and has three children, two of whom are attending primary school. Jariatu sells “gara lappers” (locally dyed cloths) and has been running this business for four years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy materials to make gara lappers--ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc.--in order to produce a larger quantity of gara cloths for sale.

loans.use: To buy materials to make gara cloth

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca S. A. is 38 years old and married. Her husband is a teacher. They have three children, ages 13-17. They hope to provide their children with a good education up to the university level. Her business is located in Kakamega, a region in Kenya known as the sugar belt for its production of sugarcane. She sells chicken feed to the local farmers. In addition to this business, she also keeps dairy cows for milk and chickens for eggs. She has been in this business for the last two years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 30,000 KES to buy more chicken feed so that she can grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business so that she can operate on a wholesale basis in the future. She also sees herself purchasing a plot of land. She describes herself as a very determined and visionary lady.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a single mother with two children. To earn a living, she runs a retail shop and also sells spirits and wines to supplement her family’s income. Being a single mother, Dorothy works hard in her business so that she can afford to educate her children. She also sells chicken when the demand is high, especially during the festival season.  

Since Dorothy joined Faulu Kenya, she has expanded her business by adding more stock. She is thankful to Faulu Kenya for funding her businesses. Dorothy is requesting another loan of 70,000 KES to buy stock such as beans, rice, and green grams (a legume crop).

loans.use: to buy beans, green grams, and rice

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is married with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has potable water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, Hadija has operated a tailoring business, selling clothes from home to her neighbors. Her major business challenge is seasonality, as during January the demand for clothing is low in comparison with December. 

Hadija decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase cloth and materials for tailoring. In the future, Hadija hopes to establish a wholesale tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela  solicito 900 $us; ella trabaja como cajera de una empresa. Vive en la zona de Munaypata de la ciudad de La Paz; está casada.
 El crédito lo destinara en la continuación de estudios superiores, costo de su tesis y título en provisión nacional;  de esta manera ella estará en condiciones de mejorar sus aspiraciones laborales y conseguir un ascenso en su trabajo o un mejor trabajo en otro lado.
 Es el tercer crédito  que solicita en Impro y el segundo  vía Kiva. Su historial de pagos la califica como cliente 1, con un excelente historial.
texts.en:
Pamela  is requesting $900 USD. She works as a cashier in a business. She lives in the Munaypata zone of the city of La Paz. She is married.
She will use this loan to continue her higher education; for the cost of her thesis and professional certification. This way, she will be in the position to improve her job prospects and get a promotion or a better job elsewhere.
This is her third loan with Impro and her second with Kiva. Her payment history qualifies her as a 'client 1', with an excellent record.

loans.use: the cost of the preparation and defense of her thesis in the University, and the cost to apply for her professional certification.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 43 years old, married, and blessed with three children. He operates Seta Plumbers Enterprise where he is a plumber. In addition, Peter sells water for extra income. He has three years of experience in the plumbing business and was previously employed by a plumbing company where he gained his skills. Peter employs one person in his business and he is looking forward to hiring more in the future. Through Faulu Kenya, Peter has managed to open a kiosk and he has also expanded his business to charge mobile phone batteries for a fee. 

Peter is requesting 70,000 KES to buy pipes and fittings.

loans.use: to buy fittings and pipes

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca; ella tiene 40 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de panadería ella vende tortas, pan, pasteles entre otros más, la socia lleva años en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante, la socia abre su negocio a partir de las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como harina, manteca, azúcar entre otros más para asi poder abastecerse de mercaderia.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the ” MUJERES UNIDAS” ["United Women"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Francisca. She is 40, married, and has 4 children. She has a baker's shop and sells pies, bread, and cakes, among other items. She has had this business for years and is happy that its revenue is supporting her family. She opens her business from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies for her business, such as flour, butter, and sugar, among other items, in order to stock up on merchandise.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: the member is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies for her business, such as flour, butter, and sugar, among other items, in order to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 46 year old business-man.  He sells second-hand clothes so as to earn a living.  His business is based in Kibera slums with most of his customers being low-income earners.  He has been running the business for three years with one employee.  He has been able to grow his business with the funds from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to open a boutique in five years.  He has requested for 40,000 Kes to buy children clothes, ladies suits and sweaters.

loans.use: To buy children clothes, ladies suits and sweaters.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a tailoring school for the past nine years, training students from her neighboring community. Loyce faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in the price of cloth materials. She hopes to expand and operate as a big tailoring training school in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, overlocks and zigzag machine. She decided to join Yehu because it provides good services to its clients.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials, overlocks and a zig zag machine.

loans.name: Alexis  Genaro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES  UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alexis Genaro; el tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente; el socio se es egresado de la Universidad de Bella Artes del Cusco, el socio se especializo en  pintura lo cual le llena de alegría y satisfacciones ya que es lo que le gusta hacer, el realiza diferente tipo de pinturas para poder vender a sus clientes y personas que le solicitan, el socio espera poder terminar de graduarse para así poder seguir demostrando su arte ya que él es una persona bien perseverante.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para su negocio como telas, bastidores, pintura al oleo entre otros más.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the ” MUJERES UNIDAS” ["United Women"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Alexis Genaro. He is 26 and in a common-law marriage. He is a graduate of the Universidad de Bella Artes del Cusco [University of Fine Arts of Cusco]. He is specialized in painting. Painting fills him with joy and satisfaction, since it is what he loves doing. He makes different types of paintings to sell to his clients and to people who make orders. He hopes to finish his schooling soon in order to be able to continue showing off his art. He is a very persevering person.

He is requesting this loan to buy materials for his business such as fabric, frames and oil paints, among other items.

He is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of his quotas.

loans.use: the member is requesting this loan in order to purchase materials for his business, such as fabrics, frames,  and oil paint, among others.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel; ella tiene 50 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia tiene su carro una combi el cual presta servicio público por el centro de la ciudad, quien maneja su carro es su esposo siendo su horario desde las 06:00 am hasta las 10:00pm todos los días, la socia a la vez viaja a Machupicchu llevando diferente tipo de víveres a sus clientes para que ellos puedan abastecer sus tiendas y así vender sus productos, la socia es una persona bien optimista y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por sus hijos.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de llantas para su combi y para comprar algunos víveres como arroz, azúcar, leche, agua, gaseosas, golosinas entre otros más para distribuirlo a sus clientes en Machupicchu.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the 'Mujeres Unidas' (United Women) community bank which is located in Cusco district, province and department.

Isabel is 50 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She owns a minivan which is used to provide a public service in the city center.  It is Isabel's husband who drives the vehicle.  He works from 6.00am to 10.00pm every day.  Isabel also travels to Machpicchu, delivering food products to her customers so that they can stock their stores and sell the products.  Isabel is a very optimistic person who has a great desire to get ahead in life for her children's sake.

Isabel is requesting this loan to buy tires for her minivan and to buy some food products such as rice, sugar, milk, water, soda, candy, etc. to distribute to her customers in Machupicchu.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy tires for her minivan and to buy some food products such as rice, sugar, milk, water, soda, candies, etc. to distribute to her customers in Machupicchu.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a member of Kibera Upendo group in Faulu Kenya. He makes beads using animal bones which are a raw material for making necklaces, bangles and earrings.  In his business, he has two employees.  It’s been ten years since he started the business and has seen a lot of growth.  He hopes to open other outlets for his business in the future.  He has requested for 25,000 Kes to buy bones.

loans.use: To buy bones

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the last two years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she operates a fresh water selling business which contributes to her source of income. Zawadi faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to expand her business and sells as wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of wheat flour, maize and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of wheat flour, maize and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana tiene 58 años con sus 3 hijos. Ana brinda el servicio de costura, hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, pues con el paso del tiempo ha logrado obtener su propio medio de ingreso. Pues siempre le ha gustado mantener este medio de vida ya que ha sido el único medio de apoyo. Ha tenido muchas dificultades una de ellas ha sido problemas de salud, pero la lucha constante de salir adelante y mantener a su familia ya que es ella quien es responsable del pan de cada día. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de hilos, tijeras, telas, zipper, cintas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Ana is 58 years old and has three children.  She owns a sewing business which she has had for more than 10 years.  Over the years, she has managed to make her living through this business.  She has always enjoyed making a living in this way and it has been her sole means of support.

Ana has experienced many difficulties, including health problems, but she continues to struggle to get ahead and support her family since she is responsible for putting food on the table.  Ana is requesting a loan to buy thread, scissors, fabric, zips, ribbons and other products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia forma parte del banco comunal “Millaray”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.  Ella tiene una pensión para estudiantes,  hace 20 años, la cual atiende solo de marzo a diciembre. Después que quedó viuda, su pareja le ayuda en la mantención y administración de la pensión. El servicio que entrega Sonia a sus clientes incluye aseo y comida. 
Durante los meses de enero y febrero, no arrienda la pensión porque prefiere descansar y hacer las reparaciones que sean necesarias. Se apoya económicamente por una pequeña suma de dinero que recibe como pensión de viudez por su difunto marido y  cocina para vender humitas y pastel de choclo.
Con este préstamo Sonia comprará 5 puertas para cambiar las que tienen las habitaciones de su pensión y también contratará a un maestro para que repare una gotera del techo y pinte una parte de su terraza.
El sueño de Sonia es construir un 2º piso con más habitaciones para arrendar. 
Su motivación es ayudar económicamente a sus 3 hijas y nietos, con quienes, aunque no viven con ella, Sonia se siente comprometida.
A Sonia le han servido mucho los préstamos que recibe de Fondo Esperanza, ya  que cuenta con ese capital de forma segura. Las capacitaciones le han servido para organizar sus gastos. También se siente muy bien por la confianza que se le mostró al concederle los préstamos y además tiene una muy buena relación con sus compañeros de grupo.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the "Millaray" community bank which is located in the city of Temuco.  She has been running a guest house for students for 20 years.  She works there from March to December.  Sonia is a widow.  Her partner helps her to maintain and run the guest house.  Sonia's services include cleaning and providing food.

During the months of January and February, Sonia doesn't rent out her guest house because she prefers to rest and make any necessary repairs.  She is supported financially by a small sum of money that she receives as her widow's pension and also from cooking and selling 'humitas' and 'pastel de choclo' (traditional dishes).

Sonia will use this loan to buy five doors to replace existing doors on the rooms in her guest house.  She will also hire a master builder to repair a leak in the roof and paint part of her outdoor area.  Sonia's dream is to build a second floor with more rooms to rent out.  Her motivation is to financially help her three daughters and grandchildren to whom she feels very committed, even though they no longer live with her.

Sonia's previous loans from Fondo Esperanza have been very useful.  It has been useful for her to be able to rely on this capital.  The training sessions have also helped her to organize her expenses.  She feels very good about the fact that Fondo Esperanza have placed their trust in her by giving her the loans.  She also has a very good relationship with her fellow group members.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  On the outskirts of the city, there are a series of lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very colorful native flora and fauna can be found in nearby nature reserves.  We feel it is worth pointing out that this region is home to 50% of the Mapuches (indigenous people) in our country.

loans.use: To buy five doors and pay for repairs

loans.name: Philister

texts.en: Philister is 37 years old, married and a mother of two.  For eleven years, she has been cooking and selling chips in her food stall in Kibera slums. She says that she is a devoted Christian who is optimistic in life. Her aspirations is to open a wholesale shop for selling shoes in the future.  She has requested for 20,000 Kes to buy cooking fat and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat and potatoes

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
María José es comerciante en la venta de productos lácteos, desde hace varios años, iniciando con ayuda familiar, casada, con un hijo, teniendo la ayuda de su esposo quien labora en servicios de seguridad.
Durante un periodo de seis ciclos, ha venido invirtiendo más en su negocio, como mejoras de vivienda con financiamiento que afodenic ha dado.
María espera con este nuevo crédito, comprara más cantidad de queso, crema, cuajada fresca y seca. Logrando mejores resultados de ganancias.
texts.en:
María José has been selling dairy products for several years.  She started with help from her family.  She is married and has one child.  Her husband, who works as a security guard, helps her.

For six cycles she has been investing more in her business.  With financing from Afodenic, she has done things like make improvements to her home.

María plans to use the new loan to buy a greater quantity of cheese, cream, and cottage cheese.  That way she will get better earnings.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of cheese to increase her sales

loans.name: Haydde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Haydee; ella tiene 70 años de edad, separada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de venta de productos remojados como moraya,chuño entre otros productos más, la socia vende todos los días en el mercado de Túpac Amaru esto en la Av. La Cultura de Cusco ella vende desde las 09:00amhasta las 05:00pm siendo esta su única actividad que realiza el cual le hace posible aun poder ayudar a sus hijos cuando lo necesitan, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para su negocio y así poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera vender más productos. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the 'Mujeres Unidas' (United Women) community bank which is located in Cusco district, province and department.

Haydee is 70 years old, separated, and has 4 children.  She has a business selling products such as 'moraya' and 'chuño' (both are types of freeze-dried potatoes).  She makes her sales every day of the week in the Túpac Amaru market in Cusco's Avenida La Cultura.  She works from 9.00am to 5.00pm.  This is her only business and it enables her to help her children when they need it.  Haydee is a very happy woman who has a great desire to get ahead in life.

Haydee is requesting this loan to buy more products for her business so that she can offer her customers more variety and, thereby, sell more products.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business so that she can offer her customers more variety and, thereby, sell more products

loans.name: Luz  Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Carlota; ella tiene 56 años de edad, viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de compra y venta de ropa ella vende polos, blusas, jeans, chompas, casacas entre otros mas de forma ambulatoria ofreciendo a sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, la socia es profesora cesante y se dedica a esta actividad hace ya un tiempo atrás, la socia es una persona bien optimista y alegre.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería de ropa para su negocio y así poder tener más variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Carlota belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Luz Carlota, age 56, is a widow with five children.  She has a business buying and selling clothes.  She sells polo type shirts, blouses, jeans, sweaters, and jackets among others.  She sells in an itinerant manner to her friends, neighbors, and relatives.  She is a retired teacher, and she has been doing this business activity for some time.  She is a very optimistic and happy person.

She is requesting the loan to buy more clothing merchandise for her business.  That way she will have a greater variety to offer her customers.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more clothing merchandise for her business in order to be able to have a greater variety to offer her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia tiene un kiosco escolar donde vende todo tipo de golosinas como chizitos, galletas, dulces, chicles, chupetines entre otros más, 
la socia es una persona muy optimista y con muchas ganas de salir adelante ya que por este medio ella saca a su familia adelante,ella trabaja todos los días de lunes a viernes desde las 08:00 hasta la 13:00pm.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería de golosinas para su negocio y así tener más variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Victoria is 42 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has five children.  She has a school kiosk where she sells all types of things like puffed cheese snacks, cookies, sweets, gum, lollipops, and many more things.  She is a very optimistic person with a great desire to get ahead.  This is the way she gets her family ahead.  She works all day Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m.

She is requesting the loan to buy more sweets for her business.  That way she will have a greater variety of merchandise to offer her customers.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more sweets for her business in order to offer her customers a greater variety of merchandise

loans.name: Paula Marlene

texts.es:
Paula es una pequeña comerciante, de venta de ropa de  segunda mano, el cual compra en paca, teniendo varios años en la venta en este negocio en donde vende en su casa de habitación.
Que con ayuda de su esposo ha construido poco a poco para un mejor futuro familiar. Trabajando como ingeniero civil.
Inicio con poco ropa, lo que comienza a obtener financiamiento en Afodenic, para agrandar sus ventas ofreciendo más variedad de ropa y captando mayor cantidad de clientes.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo comprara tres pacas en donde vienen con variedad de estilo de ropa para dama, caballeros, niños, entre otros como sabanas, peluches. Lo que espera seguir creciendo en su negocio y poder cubrir sus necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Paula is a small businesswoman, and she sells second-hand clothes.  She buys the clothes in bulk.  She has been in this business for several years, and she sells from her home.

Her husband, who works as a civil engineer, has helped her build the business, little by little, in order to have a better future for her family.

She started with just a little clothing.  She started getting financing from Afodenic in order to increase her sales.  This way she offered a greater variety of clothes and gained more customers.

She will use this new loan to buy three bundles with a variety of styles for women, men, and children.  She will also buy things like sheets and stuffed animals.  She hopes to keep growing in her business and to be able to cover her personal necessities.

loans.use: To buy three bundles of clothes in order to have better sales and keep her customers

loans.name: G.s. Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: Yanilda M. se dedica al comercio de prendas de oro y plata y el crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de este tipo de productos. Otra de las integrantes del grupo es Yessica Del Socorro su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y usada, Ella desea establecer su propio negocio en su casa con vitrinas y más estabilidad, por lo que ese es su sueño. La señora Candida tiene 27 años de edad, ella tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Su esposo es agricultor. Josefina tiene su negocio que es la venta de frutas y verduras Sus éxitos recientes es que ha podido levantar su negocio con los prestamos. Juntas han tratado de sacar ganancias de sus negocios y siempre agradeciendo los financiamientos, por lo que este financiamiento que solicitan es para invertirlo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Yanilda M. sells gold and silver jewelry.  She invested her previous loan in buying this type of product.

Another member of this group is Yessica Del Socorro.  Her business is selling new and used clothes.  She would like to set up her own business in her home with display cabinets and more stability.  This is her dream.

Candida is 27 years old.  She has four dependent children and her husband is a farmer.

Josefina has a business selling fruit and vegetables.  She has enjoyed recent success in boosting her business through loans.

These women have worked together to make profits from their businesses and they are always grateful for their loans.  They are requesting this loan to invest in their businesses.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: G.s. El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: La señora Lisett Del Carmen tiene 28 años de edad, es casada con dos hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y otros artículos en general, ya que en su casa de habitación posee una pequeña pulpería. Este negocio inicio desde hace 5 años, con el esfuerzo de ella y su esposo, buscando como tener una forma de tener su propio empleo y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.  Otra integrante del grupo es Mercedes Nohemí la cual tiene 21 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad. Su esposo es albañil. Ella tiene en su casa habitación una pequeña pulpería, a la cual pretende invertirle para poder sacar más ganancias. Ellas solicitan este crédito para poder invertirle a su negocio y comprar productos varios y así diversificar la venta.
texts.en:
Lisett Del Carmen is 28 years old, married, and has two children aged 4 and 6.  Her business is selling basic grains and other items in general since she has a small grocery store located in her home.  She started this business 5 years ago through her own hard work and that of her husband, as she was looking for a way of becoming self employed and helping her husband with their household expenses.

The other member of this group is Mercedes Nohemí who is 21 years old, married, and has a 5 year-old son.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Mercedes Nohemí also has a small grocery store in her home.  She would like to invest in her business in order to make more profit.  The women are requesting this loan to invest in their businesses, buying various products, so that they can diversify their sales.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
Como un legado familiar se podría describir la legumbrería de Efraín O. H. quien trabaja en compañía de sus padres para solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Desde pequeño, Efraín vio como su padre trabajaba en este negocio, lo que le permitió convertirse en el dueño de su propio negocio, pues a pesar de las pocas ventas en algunas épocas del año y la falta de capital para proveer a sus clientes de más productos, Efraín considera que hay que rebuscársela para sobrevivir. 

Su legumbrería es un negocio pequeño ubicado en Puerto Berrío- Antioquia a orillas del río Magdalena, actualmente Efraín requiere de un crédito para comprar surtido en mayores cantidades y así aumentar su capital de trabajo para responder a las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The family business could be described as a produce market and Efrain O. Hernandez works alongside his parents, earning money to cover the household expenses. Since he was young, Efrain saw how his father managed the business, which taught him to have a small business of his own. During certain times in the year the sales are low and there aren't enough capital funds to provide his clients with more products. Efrain feels like he always needs to be creative in order to survive. 

His produce market is a small business located in Puerto Berrio-Antioquia, along the shores of the river Magdalena. Efrain requests a loan to purchase larger quantities of a variety of products to supplement his inventory and to meet his clients' needs.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for his store.

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married with grown up children. He owns a small business selling clothing, shoes, as well as seeds and fertilizers in seven small towns in Nova Kahovka area. 

Mykola started this business 5 years ago. Today he's got many repeat clients. Mykola goes to each place once a week to bring his inventories. He also takes individual orders from people and brings them what they ask for.

Mykola is requesting a loan of 16,000 Grivnas to increase his working capital. He is hoping to make additional profit and use it to improve his family living conditions.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: El Sr. Lucio vive en la localidad de el Torno, es nacido en el departamento de Cochabamba donde por cuestiones de busca de empleo se vino a radicar a Santa Cruz, su esposa con la cual tiene 6 hijos se dedica a la venta de comida, en el mercado central de la comunidad, hace unos 6 años que se dedica a este negocio; el se dedica  al transporte de persona desde el torno a la ciudad de Santa Cruz, hace unos 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad,  el destino del crédito es para terminar de construir su domicilio, necesita comprar material de construcción es unos de los clientes mas antiguo de la institución, demostró responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas es muy trabajador y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Lucio lives in El Torno.  He was born in the Cochabamba department, but he moved to Santa Cruz to look for work.  His wife, with whom he has six children, sells food at the community’s central market.  She has had this business for six years.

He devotes himself to transporting people from El Torno to the city of Santa Cruz.  He has been doing this for eight years.

The loan is to finish building his house.  He needs to buy construction material.  He is one of the institution’s oldest clients.  He demonstrated responsibility in making his payments, and he is very hard-working.  He is grateful to the institution for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Candy Nattalli

texts.es: La Sra. Candy trabaja con nosotros desde principios del año 2010 en este tiempo  demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad, La Sra. Candy vende tucumanas de carne picada y huevo en la puerta del mercado de la Zona, ella es muy conocida por la zona ya que sus tucumanas son muy ricas y tiene bastante  clientela que viene desde otras zonas solo por comprar sus tucumanas, otra actividad que tiene ella es la de un bazar que lo tiene en el mercado en los primeros puestos del mercado donde vende juguetes, ropa, aretes, collares y otros, el préstamo que solicitan es para la compra de miniaturas y billetitos para la feria de las alasitas(La Feria de las Alasitas es una feria artesanal cuya característica principal es la venta de miniaturas con la finalidad ritual de que las mismas se conviertan en realidad, El nombre de la Feria deriva del aymara Challasita o Alasita es una palabra del Jaya Mara, (Del Tiempo) de los primeros habitantes de estas tierras, haciendo una celebración ofrecida a la Pachamama)	La Sra. Candy en su bazar venderá estas miniaturas, es una persona muy trabajadora se dedica vender variedad de productos según a la temporada, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Candy has worked with us since the beginning of the year 2010.  During this time she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality.  Candy sells minced meat and egg “tucumanas” (fried turnovers) at the entrance to the area’s market.  She is very well-known in the area because her tucumanas are very delicious.  She has many customers who come from other zones solely to buy her tucumanas.

Another business activity she has is a small variety store, which is one of the first stands in the market.  She sells toys, clothes, earrings, necklaces, and more.  

She is requesting the loan to buy miniature replicas and “billetitos”(miniature money) for the Feria de las Alasitas.  The Alasitas Fair is a handicrafts fair.  Miniature replicas are primarily sold there and then used as offerings to the Pachamama (Mother Earth).  People believe that their offerings will make their dreams come true.  The name of the fair is derived from Challasita.  Challasita or Alasita is a Jaya Mara word (From Time) from the first inhabitants of this land.   

Candy will sell these miniatures at her store.  She is a very hard-working person who sells a variety of products according to the season.

She is grateful to the institution for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: To buy miniature replicas and bills for the Las Alasitas

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Leticia; ella tiene 54 años de edad, separada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de pensión familiar ella brinda el servicio de almuerzo todos los días de lunes a viernes en su casa, ella tiene pensionados algunos vecinos y familiares, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este trabajo ella se distrae y se siente bien, la socia es profesora cesante y con este trabajo ella está feliz.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos como arroz, aceite, menestras, frutas entre otros más para su negocio de pensión familiar.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leticia belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Leticia is 54 years old, separated, and has three children.  She has a boarding house.  She offers lunch service from Monday through Friday in her house.  She provides services to some neighbors and relatives.  She has been in this business a good amount of time.  She is happy because this work is entertaining, and she feels good.

She is an unemployed teacher, and she is happy with this work.

She is requesting the loan to buy more supplies like rice, oil, mixed vegetables, and more for her boarding house business.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more supplies like rice, oil, mixed vegetables, and more for her boarding house business

loans.name: Jose Bartolome

texts.es: El Sr. José se dedica al servicio de transporte desde hace dos años, cuenta con vehículo de su propiedad, lo trabaja de manera personal desde horas muy tempranas, solicita el monto principalmente para la refacción de su vehículo y también para comprar material de construcción  como  vidrios y yeso para su domicilio ya que esta en obra gruesa, actualmente vive en su domicilio  conjuntamente su esposa que se dedica a labores del hogar y su  hijo que esta estudiando, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José has been providing transportation services for two years.  He has his own vehicle, which he works with starting at very early hours.

He is requesting a loan primarily to make repairs on his vehicle.  He will also buy construction materials like glass and plaster for his home because it is in rough shape.

He currently lives in his home with his wife, who devotes herself to the household chores.  He also lives with his son, who goes to school.

He is a very responsible and hard-working person.  He is always thinking about his family’s well-being.

He is very grateful to the institution for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Repair his vehicle and construction on his house

loans.name: Yankey Elizabeth Mena

texts.en: Yankey Elizabeth Mena A. is married and has four children. She has received senior high education.  Yankey operates a provision shop at Takoradi. She has been doing this for five years. Her husband is a driver. Yankey assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. The loan will help to increase her capital to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yankey plans to buy a land.

loans.use: The loan will help to increase her capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Jorge Sergio

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge  es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica al servicio de transporte como taxista. Él vive en la zona valle de las flores que se encuentra a treinta minutos del centro de la cuidad, don Jorge es un poco solitario ya que sus familiares e hijos viven en otros países. Pero a pesar de esto él continua trabajando para poder comprar una casa propia. Don Jorge trabaja mucho tiempo con nuestra institución y en este tiempo demostró ser una persona puntual y responsable, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la refacción de su movilidad y la compra de llantas. Una de las amistades mas cercanas que tiene es su vecina, doña margarita, quien vive en la casa de en frente, ella es una persona mayor de edad que se dedica a la elaboración de mantas. Don Jorge cuenta que debido a su actividad él llega a conocer a muchas personas diariamente y estas personas frecuentemente son muy amables ya que él demuestra ser también una persona respetuosa y amable.
texts.en:
Jorge is a very hard-working person.  He is a taxi driver.  He lives in the Valle de las Flores zone, which is thirty minutes from the center of the city.  Jorge is a bit lonely because his relatives and children live in other countries.

In spite of this, he continues working to be able to buy his own house.  Jorge has worked with our institution for a long time.  In that time he has shown himself to be a punctual and responsible person.  He will use the loan to refurbish his vehicle and to buy tires.

One of his closest friends, Margarita, lives in the house in front of him.  She is elderly, and she makes blankets.

Jorge says that due to his business activity he comes to know a lot of people every day.  These people are frequently very friendly because he is also a respectful and friendly person.

loans.use: To buy tires and perfom maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Krampah

texts.en:
Krampah S. sells onions in both larger and smaller quantities at Takoradi. She has been through senior high school. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. Krampah has been selling onions for two years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Demand for her onions is going high, and she is requesting to use the loan to buy additional bags of onions for resale. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.
At the time of visit, S. was yet to get her consignment. She had some few onions to show. The sack close to her was full of onions.

loans.use: she is requesting to use the loan to buy additional bags of onions for resale.

loans.name: Lilia Yudith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lilia Yudith; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carne y también vende útiles escolares, ella lleva en forma independiente a la ciudad de Quillabamba y también trabaja como secretaria en una empresa privada, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de carne y útiles escolares. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros y libros al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member who belongs to the communal bank named "Llapanchispac" and it is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco. 

Her name is Lilia Yudith. She is 30 years old and is married common-law and she has a son. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling meats and school supplies. She is also employed as a private secretary in the city of Quillabamba. She wants to improve her businesses selling meats and school supplies. She requests a loan to purchase school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, mechanical pencils, and books in wholesale. 

She is very happy to receive a loan and she is committed to the payment terms.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies for resale.

loans.name: Kishwer's Group

texts.en:
Kishwer belongs to the historic city called Multan Pakistan. Multan is famous for its shrines and hot weather. She lives there with her family in the area of Samejabad in a two room brick house for over 10 years. 
Kishwar is a housewife but she also does an embroider works as part time to financially support her husband. 
Her husband’s name is M. K. and he is a janitor of a company on low income. 
Kishwer is the mother of five sons. Her elder son is a plumber by profession while others are below 15 years of age, stay at home and don’t do anything. 
Kishwer was unable to provide education facilities to her children due to financial constraints. She hopes that her remaining children will also get job once they become older enough to support the family financially. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroider material such as beads, colored thread, clothes in bulk which will help her completing the orders on time and earns good.  
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Kishwer”.

loans.use: To buy embroider material for embroidery business

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene forma parte del banco comunal “Bíobío”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella vende abarrotes y confites en su casa, desde hace 5 años.  También vende, los días domingo, accesorios para celular, en un puesto en la feria. No atiende en la feria más días, porque le complica movilizarse con el toldo y la mercadería más días.
Tiene 3 hijos, 2 hijas de 21 y 17 años y un niño de 10 años.
Con este préstamo, más unos ahorros que tiene, quiere comprar un vehículo usado, que le facilite el transporte de su puesto en la feria.
Su sueño es tener un almacén de abarrotes con variada mercadería. 
A Marlene le ha servido mucho trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, no solo por los préstamos, sino también por la asesoría que recibe durante las reuniones de grupo por medio de talleres orientados a la administración de los negocios.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Marlene is member of the communal bank named "Biobio", located in the city of Concepcion.  She has had a grocery store and confectionary installed in her home for the past 5 years. On Sundays she also sells cell phone accessories from a stand at the fair. She doesn't attend the fair any other days because it is difficult to move all of her merchandise. 

She has 3 children, 2 daughters aged 21 and 17, and a son who is 10 years old.

This loan, in addition to some personal savings, she would like to purchase a used vehicle to facilitate the transportation of goods to her stand at the fair.

Her dream is to have a good inventory stocked with a variety of merchandise. 

It has been a great benefit for Marlene to be involved with Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner); not only for the loans but also for the additional support she receives during their meetings (workshops focused on business administration). 

Concepcion is located at the opening of the river Biobio, one of the largest rivers in the Chile's southern region known as Biobio. The region has had an important function in our history, being the location of one of the important battles and subsequent establishments, specifically during the War of Arauco. It is located in the frontier region with the Mapuche territory. Currently the city enjoys a significant economic and demographic development, becoming one of the more important urban centers in Chile with respect to demographics, administration, the economy, and commerce, only trailing behind Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: To purchase a used car.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en: Atta P. cooks food for sale at Takoradi. She is married to a driver and has five dependants. She uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of her dependants. Her loan will be used to expand her cooking business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to establish a restaurant.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to expand her cooking business.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agripina; ella tiene 48 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. restaurant, la socia prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This member pertains to the communal bank, “LLAPANCHISPAC”.  This bank is located in the Cusco District, in the Province and Department of Cusco.

This member is Agripina, who is 48 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her daily activities involve her restaurant business, where she prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  She works from 8am until 9pm every day.  She has been able to proviD. her children with a better future because of this business.  She plans to invest her loan in the purchase of cooking ingredients, such as meat, chicken, and vegetables.  

She is happy about the loan and promises to fulfill her payments.

loans.use: Purchase products to cook with, such as meat, chicken, and vegetables.

loans.name: Essoun

texts.en:
Essoun M. is married and has three children. She sells provisions in Takoradi. Essoun has attained a senior high school education. 

Essoun will use her loan to buy provisions to fill the empty shelves in her store and meet the demands of her customers. She plans to reinvest the profit from her loan into increasing her business capital.

loans.use: to buy store provisions

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Virginia; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de joyería de oro y plata, ella vende aretes, collares y pulseras, ella tiene una tienda que trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de joyas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar joyas de oro y plata.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the communal bank, “LLAPANCHISPAC”.  This bank is located in the Cusco District, pertaining to the Province and Department of Cusco.  

Her name is Virginia and she is 35 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She spends her day selling earrings, necklaces, and bracelets from her store where she works from 9am until 9pm.  She has been able to provide her children with a brighter future because of this business.  She would like to expand her jewelry business and is seeking this loan in order to be able to purchase more gold and silver jewelry.

She is happy about the loan and promises to fulfill her payments.

loans.use: To purchase gold and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes y luego lo vende en las diferentes ferias o mercados, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de animales menores. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Llapanchispac Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Sonia is 42 years old, single, and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with her business raising young animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. She then sells them in different established markets and street markets. She wants to expand and improve her business selling young animals and is requesting the loan to purchase animals.

Sonia is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame B. sells clothes for men and women along with slippers and other items of clothing. She moves her wares from one area to another in Takoradi. Maame has completed junior high school and is married with three children. Her husband is a driver and she assists him in taking care of the family’s home. 

Maame will use her loan to buy more goods and expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Giovana Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Giovana Justina; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de vinos y también trabaja en una tienda de chompas de alpaca, la socia vende los vinos en forma ambulatoria, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tienda para poder los vinos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar vinos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Llapanchispac Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Giovana Justina is 40 years old and single. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling wines and she also works at an alpaca sweater store. She sells the wines by foot and through this business, she gets her children ahead. She wants to have a store to be able to sell the wines and is requesting the loan to purchase wines.

Giovana Justina is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase wines

loans.name: Katty

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Katty; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de joyas, ella vende en forma independiente aretes, pulseras y collares de oro y plata y la socia también trabaja en una tienda de venta de chompas de alpaca, la socia quiere tener una tienda de venta de joyas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar joyas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Llapanchispac Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Katty is 33 years old, single, and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling jewelry. She sells gold and silver earrings, bracelets, and necklaces independently and also works in an alpaca sweater store. She wants to have a jewelry store and is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale jewelry.

Katty is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale jewelry

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
For the past two years, Maame K. has been selling slippers and shoes door to door in Takoradi. Maame has attained a senior high school education and is married with three children. Her husband is a driver. Maame uses her income to assist her husband in feeding, clothing and educating their children. 

Maame will use her loan to purchase additional varieties of slippers and shoes to sell. With her additional capital and profit, she hopes to be able to buy a shop.

loans.use: to purchase slippers and shoes

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Santiago; el tiene 50 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cabina de internet y también se dedica a trabajar como profesor de un instituto, el socio trabaja en su negocio de cabinas de internet desde las 2:00 p.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de cabina de internet. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar suministros para las computadoras.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Llapanchispac Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Santiago is 50 years old, single, and has two children. He alternates his daily activities with his internet cafe business and he also works as a professor at an institute. He works at his internet cafe business from 2pm to 10pm and wants to expand this business. He is requesting the loan to purchase supplies for the computers.

Santiago is happy for the loan and promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for the computers

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa B. is married and has three children. Adwoa sells cassava, palm fruits and green garden eggs (tiny eggs normally used when preparing palm nut soup) in Takoradi. Her husband is a carpenter. Her sales are used to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Adwoa will use this loan to purchase more food items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to provide a meaningful education to her children.

On the table, at Adwoa's left-hand side, are some cassavas and the green tiny garden eggs. Behind her on the table is a bowl of palm fruit.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Graciela; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de vidrios, ella vende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de vidrios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una lavadora para su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Llapanchispac Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Graciela is 28 years old, has a live-in partner, and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with her glass store business. She sells from 9am to 7pm and gets her children ahead through this business. She wants to expand her glass sales business and is requesting the loan to purchase a washing machine for her house.

Graciela is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To buy a washing machine for her house

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa S. sells bags of charcoal and groundnuts in Takoradi. She has been selling charcoal for a year. Adwoa has received senior high education. She is married to a driver and has four children. Adwoa assists her husband in providing for the family's basic needs. Her loan will be added to her initial capital to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to add to her initial capital to expand her business

loans.name: Socrates

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Socrates; el tiene 37 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de accesorios de carros, el socio vende en forma ambulatoria y también trabaja haciendo servicio de taxi, el socio quiere tener una tienda de venta de accesorios para carros. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar accesorios para carros.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the LLAPANCHISPAC communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco district, part of the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Socrates. He is 37 years old, single, with one child. This member alternates his daily activities with the business of selling car accessories. He sells as a traveling salesman. He also works offering a taxi service. The member wants to have a store selling car accessories. He is requesting this loan to buy car accessories.

The member is happy for this loan. He is committed to making all repayment installments.

loans.use: This member is requesting a loan to buy car accessories.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana M. has been selling fish in Takoradi for ten years. She is a widow and takes care of three children. She is responsible for their well-being. Her loan will be added to her working capital to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children. Juana is standing close to the oven she uses for the fish.

loans.use: to add to her working capital to expand her business

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame N. is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Maame has had senior high school education.  She has been selling provisions in Takoradi for six years. She assists her husband in educating her children. Maame will use this loan to purchase more provisions for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for resale

loans.name: Yhovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yhovana; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar y comprar mesas y sillas para el restaurant.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the LLAPANCHISPAC communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco district, part of the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Yhovana. She is 36 years old. She has a live-in boyfriend and 2 children. This member alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business. She prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner. She serves from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. With this business she gets her children ahead. This member wants to expand her restaurant business. She is requesting this loan to set up and buy tables and chairs for the restaurant.

This member is happy for the loan. She is committed to making the repayment installments.

loans.use: This member is requesting a loan to set up and buy tables and chairs for a restaurant.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena A. is married to a driver. She has had senior high school education. Mena has been selling children’s dressses, shoes and other items in Takoradi for six years. Mena uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Mena will use this loan to purchase more clothes and shoes for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mena plans to buy a shop.

In the photo, Mena has displayed a few of the dresses she sells.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama Y. has been cooking food for sale in Takoradi for 14 years now. She has received senior high education. She is divorced and has three children. She sees to the well-being of her children. Her loan will be used to expand her business. She hopes to use the profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame E. is married and has four children. She has attained a senior high school level of education. She sells firewood in Takoradi. Her husband is a mason. Maame uses her income to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills. This loan will serve as capital to expand her business. With the profit from her expanded business, Maame plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda S. is a hairdresser in Takoradi. Hilda has received junior high school education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a clerk. Hilda has been a hairdresser for three years. She helps her husband pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will serve as capital to expand her business. She hopes to save the profits from her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is married and has four children. She has had senior high school education. Janet sells fresh and frozen fish, meat and chicken in Takoradi. Her husband is a merchant. Janet uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Janet will use this loan to purchase more fish and meat to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Janet plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and meat

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. has been selling cereals, sugar and bags of charcoal in Takoradi for three years. Sarah has received senior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Sarah assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of charcoal for sale. She anticipates using the new profit to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of charcoal

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina A. sells provisions in Takoradi. Selina has received junior high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a mechanic. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her working capital to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to add to her working capital to expand her business

loans.name: Las Bomberas Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "Las Bomberas" porque la calle en la que vive la presidenta del grupo se llama Bomberos. Jhajaira Isabel es la secretaria del grupo. Jhajaira tiene 21 años, esta casada y tiene una hija de 4 años y otra que viene en camino. Ella compra su mercancia, que es ropa nueva en el centro y la vende desde su casa con las personas de la colonia. La ropa que vende es de caballero, dama y niños. Ella ha trabajado en este negocio desde hace 3 años para ayudar con los gastos de la casa. Con sus ganancias ella quiere amueblar su casa y su sueño es algun dia comprar un automovil para surtir su negocio con mas facilidad.
texts.en: This group is called "Las Bomberas" (the firefighters) because its chairwoman lives in Bomberos Street. Jhajaira Isabel is the group's secretary. She is 21 years old, married, has a 4-year-old daughter and another on the way. She buys her merchandise, which is new clothing, downtown and sells it from her home to the people of her neighborhood. She sells clothes for men, women and children. She has been in this business for 3 years to help with household expenses. She wants to use her earnings to furnish her home, and her dream is to some day buy a car to run her business more easily.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es:
María Victoria R. D. A. es una mujer emprendedora, pues gracias a su buena sazón y a su empeño por salir adelante, desD. hace 3 años le dio vida a su negocio D. comidas rápidas “La Sazón D.
