Vicky”, microempresa que le ha dado la oportunidad D. trabajar como independiente y aportar a los gastos D. su hogar. 

Aunque en las temporadas D. invierno las ventas disminuyen, Vicky como es conocida en el sector no deja D. abrir ningún día, pues considera que así sea poco algo se hace. Para continuar con su negocio, espera mejorar en muchos aspectos, con el fin D. llegar a innovar ofreciendo platos diferentes, por ahora, esta emprendedora necesita D. un préstamos para comprar un fogón, una olla, recipientes y algunos insumos que le permitirán incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María Victoria R. D. A. is an enterprising woman. She is a great cook with that special touch and thanks to her drive to succeed, she opened her fast-food business "La Sazón D. Vicky" (Vicky's Flavor) 3 years ago. Her microbusiness gave her the opportunity to work as an independent and contribute to household expenses.

Although her sales volume declines in winter, it does not prevent Vicky (as María Victoria is known in her sector) from opening every day, because she believes that every small step is progress. To go on with her business, she hopes to improve it in many ways. She will innovate and offer various dishes. Currently, the entrepreneur needs a loan to buy a stove, a cooker, pots and ingredients. All this will enable her to increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a stove, a cooker, pots and ingredients

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio es transportista propietario de un radio taxi, el vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en la zona el Kenko, con mucho esfuerzo lograron comprar un terreno en el cual construyeron su casa,  ahora el quiere invertir el dinero solicitado para el pago al albañil, puesto que  el piensa mucho en dar comodidad a su familia. El espera que con el tiempo sus hijos puedan estudiar y tener un mejor futuro, don Antonio es un buen cliente y es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito en la institución y lo solicita para hacer construir su casita, faltan algunos detalles pero ya esta su familia instalada y se sienten felices de estar juntos en su casa, es una persona muy responsable y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Antonio is works in transport and is the owner of a radio taxi. He lives with his wife and his three children in the area of Kenko. With a lot of effort, they managed to buy the land on which they built their home. Now he wants to invest the money requested in paying the bricklayer. He thinks a lot about providing comforts to his family. He hopes that with time his children can study and have a better future. Mr. Antonio is a good customer. This is the fourth time he has applied for a loan with the institution. He requests the loan to construct his small house. There are some small things missing but his family has now moved in. They are happy to be together in the house. He is a very responsible person. He feels grateful to the institution for the support it gives.

loans.use: Labor Costs for Construction

loans.name: Ortansia

texts.en:
Ortansia is an old woman from Bethlehem. She has two daughters and three sons. Ortansia's store is located in the old city of Bethlehem and she has her regular customers. Ortansia's sons are running the store, which she started 20 years ago when her husband died. 

Ortansia (who appears in the picture here in the store) is taking out her seventh loan from FATEN to purchase a larger variety of goods to increase profit, as her sons are married and consider the store their only source of income.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of goods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Ana Isabel S. C. es trabajadora en el Mercado Mayoreo como supervisora de los Colectores desde hace 10 años.
Ella tiene 50 años de edad, es soltera no tiene persona a cargo. Ha pagado 20 créditos en CEPRODEL, con este son 21 y lo utilizará para mejorar su casa como es hacer ampliación y reparaciones menores.
Ella está muy agradecida  con CEPRODEL por brindarles estos préstamos que le ayudan a mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana Isabel S. C. is a worker in the Wholesale Market. She has worked as collector supervisor for the past 10 years. 
She is 50 years old. She is single without dependents. She’s paid back 20 loans with CEPRODEL. This will be the 21st. She will use the loan to make improvements to her home, expanding it and making minor repairs. 
She is very grateful to CEPRODEL for offering its members these loans. The loans help them improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Home Improvements

loans.name: Virgilia Del Rosario

texts.es:
La pulpa de tamarindo es uno de los productos típicos de Santa Fe de Antioquia, municipio ubicado al Occidente de Antioquia, lugar de donde es oriunda Virgilia del Rosario S. B., quien desde pequeña al lado de su madrea aprendió a elaborar las pulpas. 

Actualmente, Virgilia no sólo vende pulpa de tamarindo, sino también, panelitas de coco, pues descubrió que así tiene mayores ventas y puede aportar en mayor medida a cubrir los gastos de su hogar, los cuales comparte con su esposo. 

Debido a que la cosecha de tamarindo sólo se da al iniciar el año, Virgilia necesita proveerse de dicho producto para realizar las pulpas el resto del año, lo que le permitirá garantizar la venta de su producto.
texts.en:
Tamarind pulp is one of the typical products of Santa Fe de Antioquia, a town located to the west of Antioquia. Virgilia del Rosario S. B. lives here; as a child she learned from her mother to make tamarind pulp.

Today, Virgilia sells not only tamarind pulp, but also coconut panelitas (brown sugar loafs). She discovered that thus she could increase her sales and contribute more to household expenses, which she shares with her husband.

Since tamarind is harvested only at the beginning of the year, Virgilia needs to buy now that ingredient for her pulps for the rest of the year, ensuring the sale of her product.

loans.use: To buy tamarind, an ingredient to her product

loans.name: Pablo Exalón

texts.es:
Don Pablo Exalón M. S. trabaja en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería como Conductor “A” desde hace 7 años.
El es soltero de 52 años de edad con 4 personas a su cargo. Lleva 4 créditos cancelados en CEPRODEL este es el número 5, presenta una buena moral de pago. Este crédito lo solicita para hacer mejoras en su casa.
Agradece a CEPRODEL por la oportunidad que le da ya que a través de estos créditos ha ido mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo Exalón M. S. has worked at the National University of Engineering as “A” driver for the past 7 years.
He is 52 years old. He is single with 4 dependents. He has had 4 repaid loans with CEPRODEL. This will be number 5. He shows good repayment morals. He is requesting this loan to make improvements to his home.
He thanks CEPRODEL for the opportunity he is given. Through these loans his standard of living has been improving.

loans.use: He is requesting it for home improvements

loans.name: José Hilario

texts.es:
José Hilario Q. Q. recorre desde hace 20 años algunas calles de Medellín en su triciclo ofreciendo jugos, avena, snacks y salpicón, labor que le ha permitido subsistir. José quien ya es reconocido en el sector, desea adquirir una plancha para calentar pasteles y otros productos que desea empezar a ofrecer en su tienda ambulante, además espera adquirir más surtido para ofrecer mayor variedad e incrementar sus ventas, realizarle algunos ajustes a su triciclo es otra de las necesidades. 

A sus 60 años de edad, José Hilario se siente orgulloso de su labor y espera continuar con su negocio hasta que Dios se lo permita como el mismo lo afirma.
texts.en:
José Hilario Q. Q. has traveled several streets in Medellín for the past 20 years, selling juices, oats, snacks and fruit cups. This work has allowed him to get by. Today José is known in the area. He wants to acquire a hotplate to heat up pies and other products he wishes to begin selling in his mobile store. He also hopes to acquire a greater assortment of products. This will offer more variety and raise his sales. He also needs to make some adjustments to his tricycle. 

With his 60 years, José Hilario feels proud of his work. He wishes to continue in his business as long as God permits, as he himself affirms.

loans.use: Purchase hotplate to heat up products, pay for tricycle supplies and adjustments

loans.name: Las Abejitas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Las Abejitas” se conforma por 19 emprendedores y  ubica en la comuna de San Bernardo. Sus negocios se basan principalmente en ventas de ropa, juguetes, comida rápida y helados.
María, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, en la foto se encuentra en 2º fila, sentada en 1º lugar de izquierda a derecha y sostiene un bastón en su mano, ya que padece de hemiplejia en la mitad de su cuerpo, lado izquierdo, hace muchos años. Ella vende ropa usada, ropa nueva, artículos de paquetería y toallas de mano, hace 7 años. 
Su lugar de venta es una feria cercana a su casa,  en donde trabaja 4 días a la semana, incluyendo los fines de semana. Ella traslada su mercadería sola en un carro. También vende en su casa los demás días.
Con este préstamo comprará perfumes, blusas de lycra, piscinas y flotadores inflables para niños.
Además de los ingresos por sus ventas, María cuenta con una pequeña pensión de dinero y con el pago por arriendo de 2 piezas, las cuales están en la parte de atrás de su casa.
Su sueño es tener un bazar y  paquetería en su casa.
María está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, por la ayuda que le han dado a través de los préstamos, ya que siente que tiene oportunidades para surgir y por la confianza que le han demostrado con esto.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
Las Abejitas (The Little Bees) communal bank is made up of 19 entrepreneurs. It is located in the town of San Bernardo. Members’ businesses are based mostly in clothing, toy, fast food and ice cream sales. 
María is the president of this group. She is in the 2nd row in the picture, seated in the 1st spot from left to right. She has a cane in her hand because she has suffered for many years from hemiplegia in the left half of her body. She has sold second-hand and new clothing, stationary and sewing supplies and hand towels for the past 7 years.
She sells her items at a market close to her house. She works there four days a week, including weekends. She moves her merchandise alone in a car. The rest of the week she also sells from home. With this loan she will buy perfumes, lycra blouses and children’s pools and floats.
In addition to the income from her sales, María receives a small pension and payment for renting 2 rooms in the back of her house. 
Her dream is to have a stationary and embroidery shop in her home.
María is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza for the help they have given her through these loans. She feels that she has opportunities to rise up. She thanks them for the faith they have shown in her through this. 
San Bernardo is a city located 18 km. south of the main square of Santiago (the capital of Chile) using a straight line. It is know as the capital of folklore culture; every year in January they have the “International Folklore Festival”. This is an event where the country’s roots come together. Musical groups from all over South America meet. There is also a “Traditional Crafts Fair”. Artisans from Chile and other nearby countries participate. Later, in April, the “One Thousand April Cuecas” event takes place. The whole town is made to dance cueca (a traditional Chilean dance) during the event.

loans.use: Perfumes, clothing and children's pools and floats

loans.name: Marta Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña  Marta del Socorro Q. F. trabaja en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería como Conserje desde hace 20 años.
Ella es soltera de 50 años de edad con 3 personas a su cargo. Lleva 3 créditos cancelados en CEPRODEL los cuales ha pagado en tiempo y forma los que ha utilizado para ir mejorando su casa.
Ella utilizará este crédito para compra de Materiales de Construcción.
texts.en:
Ms. Marta del Socorro Q. F. has worked at the National University of Engineering as a custodian for the past 20 years.
She is 50 years old. She is single with 3 dependents. She has paid off 3 loans from CEPRODEL. They have been repaid on time. She has used them to make improvements to her house.
She will use this loan to buy construction materials.

loans.use: She requests the loan to buy construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Rebuscarse el dinero para aportar al sustento de su familia es la filosofía de María Elena B., quien desde hace algún tiempo decidió ser independiente montando su propio negocio en el centro de Medellín, allí esta emprendedora tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en una de las vías principales del sector donde vende snacks, café preparado y minutos a celular, trabajar más de 10 horas diarias no es impedimento para que María Elena realice su trabajo. 

Actualmente María Elena necesita de un crédito para comprar surtido en cantidad lo que le permitirá comprar a un menor costo para obtener mayores ganancias, así mismo desea comprar un celular ya que el que tiene ya está fallando y eso le impide vender aún más minutos, además necesita cancelar lo que le adeuda a uno de sus proveedores. 

María Elena espera continuar con su negocio y sueña con tener cada vez más variedad de mercancía para salir adelante con su familia y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su nieto.
texts.en: Doing what she can to make money to provide for her family is the philosophy of María Elena B., who some time ago decided to start a business on her own in the center of Medellín. It is there this enterprising woman has a small store located on one of the sector's main roads, selling snacks, prepared coffee and cell phone cards. She works more than 10 hours a day, but that does not impede her from doing her job. Currently, María Elena is requesting a loan to purchase supplies in bulk, which will allow her to buy the items at a lower price and increase her profits. She also wishes to purchase a cell phone since the once she has is broken, which prevents her from selling even more cell phone cards. Furthermore, she needs to pay off what she owes to one of her suppliers. María Elena hopes to continue her business and dreams of having a wider variety of merchandise to keep making headway with her family and providing a better future for her grandson.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and a thermos, and pay suppliers.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Tener su propio local es el sueño de Gilberto E. I., quien desde hace 10 años inició con la venta de legumbres, snacks y cajas tomateras en un puesto de la plaza de mercado de Sonsón, municipio ubicado al Oriente de Antioquia. 

Con su trabajo, Gilberto cubre los gastos de su hogar conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos, actualmente requiere de un préstamo para proveerse de más surtido y así lograr incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Having his own store is the dream of Gilberto E. I., who 10 years ago started selling legumes, snacks and boxes of tomatoes at a post in the plaza market of Sonsón, a municipality located to the east of Antioquia. With his job, Gilberto covers the expenses for his household, which consists of his wife and two children. Currently, he is requesting a loan to bring in more supplies and thus successfully increase his sales.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge de 56 años, es un hombre trabajador que ha tenido la oportunidad de ser microempresario por la buena administración que le ha dado a su negocio. 

Viviendo en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil ha trabajado en su local dando el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de impresoras. En la actualidad tiene dos empleados que le ayudan desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm arreglando y reparando impresoras. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar prestando el servicio a los clientes pero para seguir tiene que comprar con el préstamo herramientas para la debida reparación de las impresoras. 

En el futuro quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio y tener mejores ingresos para mejorar el estilo de trabajo.
texts.en: Jorge is 56 years old. He is a hard-working man who has had the opportunity to be a small businessman thanks to his good business administration. Living in Orquídeas de Guayaquil, he has worked at his shop providing maintenance and repair services for printers. Currently, he has two employees who help him fix and repair printers from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. He has many aspirations for his business, and it's for this reason he wants to continue providing his services to customers. However, in order to continue he must purchase tools with the loan so he can make proper repairs. In the future, he wants to keep on growing his business and have more income to make improvements.

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: Nelsy Liliana

texts.es:
Llegar a tener un almacén especializado en ropa de bebés y niños, es el sueño de Nelsy Liliana M. M., quien decidió convertirse en microempresaria por su experiencia laboral en algunos almacenes del municipio de San Carlos Antioquia, lugar de donde es oriunda. 

Su negocio de venta de mercancía, especialmente de ropa de bebe, le ha permitido a esta emprendedora contribuir con el cubrimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Para Nelsy la principal dificultad que debe sobrellevar es la competencia ya que allí son muchas las personas que se dedican a este oficio. 

Actualmente, Nelsy requiere de un préstamo para adquirir mercancía y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, así como la compra de estantería para exhibir de mejor forma la ropa que actualmente vende.
texts.en:
Opening a store that specializes in clothing for infants and children was the dream of Nelsy Liliana M. M.. She decided to become a small business owner because of her experience working in some of the shops in San Carlos Antioquia, her hometown.

Her business of selling merchandise, especially baby clothes, has allowed this entrepreneur to contribute toward her household expenses. Nelsy’s main challenge to overcome is the competition since there are many people who engage in this type of business.

At the moment, Nelsy needs a loan to acquire merchandise and offer a greater variety of products to her customers. She will also buy shelving so that she can better display the clothing she currently sells.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & shelving for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Money to buy construction materials

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: Benita tiene 48 años, es una madre de familia amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y su hija Yoselin de 12 años de edad. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de aretes, collares, carteras y prendas de vestir, en un centro comercial muy concurrido. Este trabajo le es muy conveniente, ya que un familiar también se dedica a la venta de estos productos y es quien le prevé de mercadería para vender, por ello cuenta con una gama de productos de calidad y de alto precio y que tiene mucha aceptación por sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que conoce mucha gente, de esa manera se distrae, así que cuando posee de nueva mercadería rápidamente visita a sus clientes. Lleva dos años en este negocio, dejando a crédito o al contado los productos que vende; pero a veces se le complica cuando tiene un cliente que no termina de pagar sus cuotas. En adelante planea construir su casa, ya que actualmente es de madera, así mismo acondicionar un espacio para su negocio. Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y sabe que este crédito que necesita será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Asimismo se desempeña en su grupo comunal como una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cuál es muy respetada. Benita, tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de prendas de vestir casuales, para la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
48 year-old Benita is a kind and unassuming mother who lives in her own home together with her husband and 12 year-old daughter Yoselin.  Benita's business is selling earrings, necklaces, purses and clothes in a very busy shopping center.  This business is very convenient for her as one of her family members also sells these products and provides her with merchandise to sell.  This means that she has a range of high-price, good-quality products which are very popular with her customers.  What Benita most likes about her business is that she gets to know a lot of people, it keeps her occupied and whenever she has any new merchandise she quickly visits her customers.

Benita has been in this business for two years, selling her products for cash or leaving them on credit.  However, sometimes things get complicated when she has a customer who doesn't pay all of their instalments.  In the future, Benita plans to re-build her home since it is currently made from wood.  She would also like to remodel a space for her business.

This is Benita's 11th loan with MFP and she knows that this loan she needs will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank and is therefore very well respected.  Benita plans to invest her loan money in buying casual clothes for the summer season.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Griselda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Griselda del Socorro D. P. es comerciante en el Mercado Roberto Huembes desde hace 10 años. Su negocio es venta de Ropa Variada y Gaseosa ubicada detrás de la alcaldía en el Mercado Roberto Huembes.
Ella es madre soltera con 3 hijos a cargo en edad escolar. Este es su primer crédito en CEPRODEL, lo utilizará para compra de una caja de Camisas de Uniforme de diferentes tallas que le cuesta C$ 5787 aproximadamente.
texts.en:
Doña Griselda del Socorro D. P. has been a merchant at the Roberto Huembes market for ten years. Her business of selling different clothes and sodas is located behind City Hall in the Roberto Huembes Market.

Griselda is a single mother with three dependent children who are of school age. This is her first loan with CEPRODEL and she will use the funds to buy a box of uniform shirts in different sizes that costs approximately 5787 NIO.

loans.use: Purchase a box of uniform shirts in different sizes

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Con herramienta prestada y con la esperanza de hacer de su taller de mecánica un negocio próspero, desde hace 17 años, Guillermo B. C., empezó con su negocio, el cual ha sido la fuente de sustento para él y su familia conformada por tres hijos. 

Ofrecerle educación superior a su hija menor, es el sueño de Guillermo y para lograrlo requiere que su negocio permanezca en el tiempo, pues así podrá contar con los ingresos que puedan hacer de este sueño una realidad. Actualmente este emprendedor requiere de un préstamo para la adquisición de herramientas que le permitirán agilizar el proceso del montaje de las llantas, así logrará atender mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Seventeen years ago, Guillermo B. C. started his business with borrowed equipment and the hope of making his repair shop successful. This business is the means by which he supports himself and his family, which includes three children.

Guillermo dreams of providing his youngest daughter with a higher education. In order to do this, he must keep his business in operation so that he will have the income to make this dream a reality. This entrepreneur currently needs a loan to acquire equipment that will enable him to streamline the process of mounting tires and provide high quality service to his customers.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for mounting tires

loans.name: Aura

texts.es: Aura tiene 58 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años y medio vende  carne de cerdo frita a la que le llaman chicharrón, este plato  típico de su zona es uno de los más consumidos por los lugareños, quienes acuden a comprar una porción de ese platillo. Su negocio permanece toda la tarde hasta altas horas de la noche y al día siguiente, desde muy temprano nuevamente a comprar los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus platillos. Durante estos largos de experiencia, ha logrado ganar experiencia y establecer su negocio y eso la anima a continuar adelante en la venta de sus comidas e implementar mejor su negocio. Es el crédito número 18 con MFP, se siente seguro de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece además a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá compra nuevas sillas y también algunos ingredientes, perecibles y no perecibles.
texts.en:
Aura is 58 years old and is a widow.  She owns her own house and lives with her two children.  For the past 20 years she has been selling a fried pork dish called chicharrón.  This is a traditional dish from her region and one of the most popular among the locals.  Her business is open every afternoon until late into the night.  Early the next day she goes out to buy the necessary ingredients to prepare her dishes.  She has gained a lot of experience during this long period of time and has established her business.  This inspires her to continue selling her food and improve her business.  

This is her 18th loan with MFP and she feels safe knowing that she has financial support.  She has always been responsible with her payments and is pleased to be a part of her communal bank as all the members are responsible and very unified.  She is grateful to all the people who will be involved in making this loan possible since it will be very useful in advancing her business.  With the loan she is requesting, she will be able to buy new chairs as well as perishable and nonperishable ingredients.

loans.use: To purchase perishable and nonperishable ingredients as well as new chairs for her business.

loans.name: Julián De Jesús

texts.es:
Julián de Jesús M. M. inició su tienda de mercado hace 11 años, un pequeño local, poco surtido y las ganas de salir adelante fueron el inicio de lo que hoy se ha convertido en su fuente de sustento. Además de los productos para la canasta familiar, Julián desea expandir su negocio hacia la venta de cerveza, pues considera que ello le generará mayores ingresos y aunque cuenta con un refrigerador que le prestará un amigo, aún necesita el dinero para comprar el surtido y así empezar con esta iniciativa. 

Ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en el más concurrido de la zona, es el sueño de este microempresario.
texts.en:
Julián de Jesús M. M. started his business 11 years ago. It was a small store, with just a little stock, but his desire to succeed turned it into what is now his source of income. In addition to household items, Julian wants to expand his business into beer sales because he thinks that that would generate him a better income. Although he has a fridge which a friend is lending him, he still needs money to buy the stock and start selling beer.

This entrepreneur's dream is to expand his business until it is the most popular store in the area.

loans.use: the purchase of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, and meat

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Timoteo es socio del Banco Comunal Milagros, tiene 41 años y es soltero. Es feriante, viaja todos los sábados a Acocro, ahí compra los cereales y lo vende en el mercado Nery García otras veces en los molinos, pertenece a FINCA hace 1 año y medio, le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque le dan créditos y puede ahorrar, aprendió en las capacitaciones a como invertir su dinero. Solicita un préstamo para invertir en surtir su mercadería.
El sueño de Timoteo es poder ahorrar, para poder comparase un carro y poder viajara las ferias.
texts.en:
Timoteo is a member of the Communal Bank “Milagros” (Miracles). He is 41 years old, single, and works as a merchant. He travels every Saturday to Acocro where he buys grain and sells it at the Nery García Market and to grain mills on other occasions. Timoteo joined FINCA a year and a half ago. He enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because the members are provided loans, have the ability to save, and receiving training as to how to invest their money. He is requesting a loan to invest in increasing his inventory.

Timoteo dreams of saving toward the purchase of a car so that he can travel to the fairs.

loans.use: Purchase grain to increase his inventory

loans.name: Hector Arturo

texts.es: El Sr. Arturo solicito el crédito, porque la casa donde vive al lado de su familia en una de las habitaciones, se le trasmina el agua cuando llueve y tienen 2 niños pequeños y eso hace que la humedad los pueda enfermar al paso del tiempo, además de que es una casa que ya tiene muchos años de construida y el techo necesita reparación urgente, es por eso que el Sr. Arturo se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia y el de sus hijos pequeños, porque en caso de no arreglar el techo que les esta ocasionando problemas con esta época de frío, el teme que sus hijos se le enfermen y después va a ser mas el gasto de llevarlos al doctor, por esta razón, e se ha propuesto arreglar el techo de su casa, y así estar mas tranquilo en esta temporada de invierno, y también considera que estarán mas protegidos de la humedad.
texts.en:
Mr. Arturo is requesting this loan because the house where he lives with his family has a room whose roof leaks when it rains. He has 2 small children, and the dampness could make them sick. Furthermore, it is a very old house and the roof is in urgent need of repair. For this reason, Arturo is worried about his family's well-being, especially his two small children. He worries about what will happen if he does not fix the roof, as it is causing them problems in this cold season. He is afraid that his children will get sick and it will cost a lot to bring them to the doctor. 

For this reason, he has proposed to fix his house's roof, and thus feel more calm during this winter season. They will also be more protected from the dampness.

loans.use: waterproofing and interior and exterior roof improvements

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es: Félix tiene 57 años, vive con su esposa en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, actividad que le ha permitido sostener a su familia, hoy sus 9 hijos son personas mayores e independientes en sus propios hogares y con mas razón  trabaja con toda la energía al lado de su esposa. En épocas de siembra trabajan con la ayuda de 2 toros que posee,  útiles para el arado de la tierra, de esta manera logra las cosechas satisfactorias para ser vendidas en el mercado de su zona. Sus tierras de cultivo se ubican en una buena zona y con canales de riego que garantizan una buena cosecha por lo que  Félix continuará trabajando  en la agricultura. Es su crédito número 16  con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono  para sembrar maíz.
texts.en:
Félix is 57 years old and lives with his wife in their own house.  He has spent his entire life working in agriculture, which has made it possible for him to support his family.  Today, his nine children are independent adults with their own homes, so now he works harder than ever alongside his wife.  During the planting season, they work with the help of their two bulls, which are useful for plowing their fields.  This helps them achieve satisfactory harvests that they can sell in the markets in their region.  Their fields are located in a good area with irrigation canals that guarantee a good harvest that will keep Félix in the farming business.

This is his 16th loan through MFP and he is very happy to know that he has this financial support.  He has always shown himself to be responsible with his repayments, and he is also grateful to be part of his communal bank because all of its members are responsible and group-minded people.  He thanks all of the people who will be providing him with this loan because it will be very useful in his efforts to make progress with his business.  He will use the requested loan to buy sacks of fertilizer for planting corn.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Noemí es socia del Banco Comunal Milagros, tiene 30 años, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 12 años de edad. Noemi es feriante, viaja a las ferias de Canaria, lleva mandiles, faldas, colchas, ropas y cuando regresa de las ferias trae cereales y los vende en le Mercado Playa Grau, Maravillas o Nery García Zarate. 
A Noemí le gusta porque aprendió a ser responsable, puntual, le enseñaron a trabajar, como salir adelante frente a los obstáculos. Noemi solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en surtir su mercadería. Noemí también tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, su sueño es que crezca más, para no viajar a las ferias.
En cuanto a lo familiar, es que estén unidos y que prospera la felicidad y el amor.
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the "Milagros" ["Miracles"] Communal Bank.  She is 30 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one son who is 12 years old.  Noemí is a trader.  She travels to the fairs in Canaria, bringing aprons, skirts, quilts, and clothing.  When she returns from the fairs, she brings grains with her to sell at the Playa Grau, Maravillas, or Nery García Zarate markets.

Noemí enjoys her job because she has learned to be responsible and punctual, and it has shown her how to work and how to get ahead despite any obstacles.  Noemí is requesting a loan that she will invest in diversifying her merchandise.  Noemí also has a small store in her house, and her dream is for it to grow so that she no longer has to travel to the fairs.  As for her family, she dreams that they will be united and that their happiness and love will prosper.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as a variety of grains

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El Señor Daniel es transportista y propietario de dos movilidades,  ambas trabajan como radio taxi, una la conduce el y de la otra percibe una renta fija mensual, el vive en alquiler en la zona de Senkata junto a su pequeña hija y su esposa que se dedica a la venta de flores, contribuyendo así con el gasto en comida y transporte, con el tiempo don Daniel piensa tener su casa propia por el momento trabaja desde las siete de la mañana hasta las diez de la noche, solicito el crédito  para el mantenimiento de una de sus movilidades, don Daniel es un buen cliente y es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito en la institución, es un joven muy trabajador y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Daniel is in the transportation business and owns two vehicles, both of which he uses as radio taxis.  He drives one and rents the other out for a fixed monthly rate.  He lives in a rented home in the Senkata district, together with his young daughter and his wife, who sells flowers in order to contribute to their food and transportation expenses.  In time, Daniel would like to have his own house but for the moment, he is working from seven in the morning until ten at night.  He is requesting a loan for maintenance on one of his vehicles.  Daniel is a good client and this is his fourth time applying for a loan from Emprender.  He is a hard-working young man and is grateful for the support he is being offered.

loans.use: car maintenance

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal Virtud, tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Angelica tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general. Solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercaderías para surtir su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, harina, leche, aguas gaseosas, etc.
Angélica ingreso a Finca por la invitación de su hermana, es socia ya casi 3 años, le gusta porque puede ahorrar y con sus ahorros pudo ampliar su tienda, le dan créditos y aprende mucho de las capacitaciones que recibe de su promotora.
Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y poder ahorrar para darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Angélica is a member of Vertud community bank. She is 26 years old, married and has three children. Angélica has a store selling general groceries. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of supplies to stock her store with items such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, flour, milk, carbonated water, etc. Angélica joined Kiva partner Finca after an invitation from her sister, and she has been a member almost three years now. She enjoys it because she can save money, and with those savings she was able to expand her store, take out loans and learn a lot from the training she receives at the community bank. Her dream is for her business to keep growing and to be able to save so she can give her children a good education.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Flor Yanina

texts.es:
Flor es socia del Banco Comunal Virtud, tiene 21 años, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 1 año 4 meses.
Flor , se dedica a la comercialización de frutas. solcita un crédito, para invertir en la compra de mercadería variada para surtir su negocio.
Flor compra las frutas que llega de Lima los días sábados y lo reparte entre sus caseras, y las frutas que le queda lo vende en su puesto el resto de la semana.
a Flor le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, por los ahorros y las capacitaciones.
Su sueño es poder ahorrar para comprar su casa y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en: Flor is a member of Virtud Community Bank. She is 21 years old, lives with her common-law husband and has a 1-year, 4-month-old child. Flor makes a living selling fruits. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase various products to stock her business. Flor buys fruits that arrive in Lima on Saturdays and distributes them. She sells the remaining fruits the rest of the week. Flor enjoys the meetings with her community bank because of the savings and training sessions. Her dream is to be able to save enough to buy a home and for her business to keep growing.

loans.use: Purchase various seasonal fruits

loans.name: Promesa Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “PROMESA” es un grupo de 9 mujeres que han decidido unirse para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud,  serán parte del centro focal de Senkata, ellas están iniciando su primer ciclo.

Cada una de las socias tiene negocio propio, de servicio, producción o comercio. Entre ellos tenemos:    costura de deportivos, costura de camisas, venta de comida, tienda de abarrotes, tejido de mantas de lana de Alpaca, Taller de Chaperia, costura de Deportivos, venta de cosméticos.

Para su organización, la B. C. Promesa cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Maria Elena, una tesorera, la señora  Luisa y una secretaria de actas, la señora  Beybi Lupe.

La  Presidenta, la señora  Maria Elena vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos (de once, diez y siete años de edad).    La señora  María Elena está iniciando su negocio, ella ha proyectado la apertura de una tienda de barrio en su propio domicilio, por iniciativa propia.  En cuanto a la venta ella espera que sus hijos mayores le ayuden.

El préstamo solicitado fue por Bs.2000.- y será destinado para la compra de mercadería, como azúcar, arroz, fideo, pan.
La señora Maria Elena indica que esta es su primera experiencia como socia de Pro Mujer,  cuando se le consulta que es lo que le atrae de la institución, ella responde “el ahorro y la atención en Salud”.
texts.en: The "Promesa" ("Promise") Community Bank is a group of nine women who have decided to come together to receive a loan, training and health care. They are part of the main center in Senkata and are starting their first loan cycle. Each one of the members has her own business, as a service provider, producer or merchant. Among the jobs are: sewing sportswear; sewing shirts; selling food; running a grocery store; weaving blankets with alpaca wool; running a body shop; and selling cosmetics. The community bank has a board of directors consisting of president Maria Elena, treasurer Luisa, and secretary Beybi Lupe. President Maria Elena lives with her partner and their three children (ages 11, 10 and 7). She is starting her business. She is planning on opening up a neighborhood store and running it on her own out of her home, and she hopes her oldest children will help her. She is requesting her portion of the loan of Bs. 2000 and plans to use it to purchase supplies such as sugar, rice, noodles and bread. Maria Elena says this is her first experience as a member of Kiva partner Pro Mujer. When asked what attracted her to the institution, she said "the savings and health care."

loans.use: Compra de mercadería (azúcar, arroz, fideo)

loans.name: La Simpatia 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Ana is one of the members of the groups L. Simpatia 1, 2, 3 & 4. They are 20 borrowers dedicated to selling different products such as clothing, food and shoes and operating services such as beauty salons and others. They are located in San Pedro D. Macoris, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Ana's story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Ana is a single mother of 2 and she makes her home here in a simple structure in a rural community surrounded by sugar cane fields and a forested area.

Ana is excited about seeking her first loan with Esperanza. It will enable her to restart her business. In the past, she ran a food stall, where she sold fruits, vegetables, meat and other items. She plans to use this loan to keep doing the same, by investing in this type of merchandise and selling it to her neighbors. Her profits will be used to reinvest in her business as she wants to improve it, in the short term. Thank you for your support.

Several photos were taken in order to catch as many faces as possible.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, charcoal, meat, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Desde niña Gloria Elena S. T. descubrió que tenía grandes habilidades para lo relacionado con la belleza, con el paso de los años supo que además de dedicarse a esta actividad deseaba ser independiente, pues además de tener la posibilidad de trabajar desde su casa así tendría la posibilidad de aportar con sus ganancias para cubrir los gastos del hogar conformado por su esposo y sus 2 hijas.

Tener su propia peluquería en un local amplio y con la capacidad de ofrecer diversos servicios para satisfacer a sus clientes es el sueño de Gloria, que por ahora trabaja fuertemente para lograrlo y que además necesita de un préstamo para adquirir implementos como plancha para el cabello, cepillos, secador, máquina para motilar, entre otros artículos necesarios para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
As a girl, Gloria Elena S. T. discovered she had great talent when it comes to beauty. In addition to pursuing this activity as a profession over the years, she learned that she wanted to be independent. This has given her the opportunity to work from home and use her earnings to contribute toward the household expenses accumulated by her husband and their two daughters.

Gloria has her own beauty salon set up in an ample location. Being able to offer different services to satisfy her customers has been Gloria’s dream and is now working hard to achieve it. She needs a loan to acquire equipment such as a curling iron, brushes, hair dryers, clippers, and other items for improving her business.

loans.use: Purchase a curling iron, brushes, hair dryers, clippers, and other items
